            {
                "_id": "111173587",
                "date": "2016-10-30T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1069531",
                "reviewer_id": "87096798",
                "reviewer_name": "Steven",
                "comments": "This was my girlfriends and I's first trip to Kauai and using Airbnb. We really wanted to see and experience Kauai the best we could. When we saw Coral's ad on Airbnb we knew it would fit all of our wants and needs. Upon arriving, we were welcomed by her husband Ian who took us around their beautiful property. Location is a huge plus with this hidden gem, it is only steps away from Queen's bath and a short 5 minute ride from Hanalei, which we frequented. The pool was beautiful, even though we only used it once. Coral does a great job in making sure her guests are comfortable. Her hospitality is in a league of it's own from offering fresh fruit she grew herself to local insights on what to do and where to go. We stayed in Princeville just before their winter months. It was mostly on the windier side, but it did not inhibit our travels. The only one  recommendation we have is if you decide to take a boat tour to the Na Pali Coast to see the open-ceiling caves, go during the summer or when the swells are below 4ft. Whale season is just starting at the end of October, so keep that in mind too if you do decide to take a boat tour. Otherwise, here are our top 5 picks picks Kauai: 1. Kalalau Trail (bring shoes with traction!), 2. Ishihara Market for Poke (see Waimea Canyon same day), 3. Lawai Beach for Snorkeling (next to The Beach House), 4. Queen's Bath (sunny and low swells), 5. Kilauea Town (bakery, juice bar, lighthouse lookout). Enjoy your stay in Kauai! Mahalo! "
            },

                "comments": "Asia House  was a gem.  I was so happy and felt so lucky to have found this place last minute. The room was spacious, clean, quiet, and within 2 miles of our favorite beaches.  Our gracious host Coral provided fresh fruit from her garden, a small kitchenette, plenty of beach towels, body boards, and other beach essentials.                 "comments": "Coral and Ian are very knowledgable and have been long term residents. If you need anything or help with your trip be sure to ask them.                 "comments": "The Asia House is a lovely residence surrounded by mature gardens and designed with aesthetic beauty.                 "reviewer_id": "70070095",
                "reviewer_name": "Pierre",
                "comments": "Idéalement situé sur la rive nord de Kauai, à proximité immédiate en auto de tous les points d’intérêt et des services, l’endroit est magnifique avec une piscine et un bain tourbillon sur place, et vraiment tout près du Queen’s Bath (à visiter avec d’énormes précautions). Coral et Ian sont très gentils et accueillants, savent respecter l’intimité de leurs visiteurs, et réagissent positivement et rapidement aux besoins. Par exemple, ils nous ont cherché et trouvé une clinique médicale un jour de congé, et prêté des articles de plage en surplus de ce qu’îl y avait déjà de disponible. \n\nCoral and Ian are very good hosts and know exactly how to take good care while respecting our intimacy. They were very helpful in helping us find an open medical clinic on President’s Day. also gave us access to more beach gear than was already available. The place is as advertised, with on-site access to a pool and a spa, right across Queen’s Bath (good hike, but could be dangerous), in an especially magnificent neighbourhood, not far from shops and groceries. A very nice experience that we would repeat."

            {
                "_id": "324348449",
                "date": "2018-09-16T04:00:00.000Z",

            },
            {
                "_id": "329410555",
                "date": "2018-09-28T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1069531",
                "reviewer_id": "10108411",
                "reviewer_name": "Colleen",
                "comments": "We had a mixed experience here. The property was great; we loved the pool and hot tub in the beautiful courtyard. But the room itself was perhaps the dirtiest Airbnb I've ever stayed in. The bathroom rug was badly stained, the fan was filthy, the walls all need a scrubbing and perhaps repainting. If you're not bothered by cleanliness issues, then you'll probably like this place a lot. \n\nAs far as location, Queen's Bath and Hideaways beach are both awesome destinations within walking distance (and both have parking challenges, so walking is a big advantage). Be aware that a lot of the most popular tourist destinations/activities are far away, especially with part of the North Shore currently closed. Waimea Canyon is two hours away; most tours like flying and ziplining are 45+ minutes. The nearby grocery store (Princeville Foodland) is the most expensive place on the island so stock up on groceries closer to the airport."
            },
            {
                "_id": "331486248",
                "date": "2018-10-02T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1069531",
                "reviewer_id": "1429129",
                "reviewer_name": "Rick",
                "comments": "This is an inexpensive place in a million dollar location. It has all the necessities. It’s not a luxury condo so don’t expect that.  There were fresh fruits,  snacks, and water in the room when we arrived. And flowers and orchids everywhere. The host, Coral, and husband Ian are very friendly and gracious.  But they stay out of your way if you prefer privacy.  The grounds of this huge house are similar to an arboretum.  The en-suite bathroom and kitchen area are immaculate showing the care of a cleaner with very high standards. Look forward to returning if I can book far enough in advance to grab it."
            },
            {
                "_id": "334377825",
                "date": "2018-10-08T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1069531",
                "reviewer_id": "13480017",
                "reviewer_name": "Leigh",
                "comments": "Corals home is beautiful and she is very helpful, responsive and accomodating. The main ground looks like a beautiful botantical garden and the pool is such a beautifully designed lovely addition. Being right across from Queens Bath is also really neat! Corals husband also gave us some great tips about local gems to visit. There are a few different rooms available. My friend and I stayed in a more modest room but it had everything we needed and we were comfortable. We spent most of our time outside on the property or exploring the island so a simple room was perfect, especially on a budget.  It can be warm at night but the fan works well. I struggled a lot with the WiFi and had no cell phone service. I’m sure Coral would have reset the WiFi if we asked but for me it wasn’t necessary and I enjoyed being “unplugged” so to speak. My friend was able to get WiFi on her laptop, we just couldn’t get it on our phones for something reason. Overall this was a wonderful vacation spot!! Definitely check out the St Regis for sunset cocktails and the beautiful town of Hanalei!"
            },

            },
            {
                "_id": "342535869",
                "date": "2018-10-28T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1069531",
                "reviewer_id": "178805667",
                "reviewer_name": "Jeff",
                "comments": "When you turn into the neighborhood in Princeville, you will realize you are in a very exclusive area of Kauai.  My wife and I thought we took a wrong turn...  We didn't.  It's very very nice.  The value I was getting increased 2-fold when we pulled into the location.  \n\nCoral got me an amazing deal on a rental car.  We do not require much, and our car wasn't much.  But, it had 4 tires, A/C, great gas mileage, and pick up from the airport.  If you just need a basic car, do not go to the rental places at the airport.  Talk to Coral.\n\nThe room was what we saw on the site.  It's clean, comfortable, and is set up for you to enjoy a quick, small meal at \"home\" when you want to save some money or enjoy your own cooking.  There is ground coffee and a machine which we used every day.  Refrigerator, plates, utensils, blender (Yes, I made Pina Coladas in our room), microwave and hot plate.  Everything you need.\n\n The rainy nights were an absolute joy.  Hearing the rain on the big leafy bush in the front window was relaxing and gave that extra atmosphere of being away and relaxed.\n\nThe grounds of Asia House are amazing and welcoming.  You will love your stay here.  \n\nMy only suggestion would be a ceiling fan.  The fan provided is adequate.  Our last day was the most humid.  My wife and just sat in front of the fan to get relief.  A ceiling fan would be amazing.  However, this does not change the fact that if we go back to Kauai, we are staying at Asia House.  It's a real gem.  I would not hesitate to recommend to anyone."
            },
            {
                "_id": "345341953",
                "date": "2018-11-04T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1069531",
                "reviewer_id": "2230198",
                "reviewer_name": "Mariana",
                "comments": "Coral and Ian's home is a spectacular sight to see from outside and inside, their garden is impeccable and the neighboring homes in the area are also beautiful. Surrounded by the quiet golf course, this neighborhood is an escape from the beaten path, but also a stone's throw (quite literally) to the famous Queen's Bath hiking trail. We stayed in the lovely garden studio which was private and quiet. They supplied us with all the necessities we needed for a comfortable stay, fruits from their garden, coffee and condiments, and a nice sized fridge in the room. An indoor shower in our room as well as an outdoor shower to clean off the unavoidable mud from adventuring! We are so grateful to have had this quiet landing pad after long excursions with a firm bed to come home to. They have tips for staying cool and a fan in the room. We got to see lots of cute geckos climbing outside and explore garden critters and kitty cats. Very hard to leave!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "350272833",
                "date": "2018-11-18T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1069531",
                "reviewer_id": "6644255",
                "reviewer_name": "Gyan",
                "comments": "Coral and Ian are fabulous hosts and the property is really unique and beautiful, with above and beyond the amenities one might expect  to find. The pool and hot tub were a big bonus, as is the super close proximity to Queens Bath.  They offered good info about the local things we were looking for. And there was a welcome basket of yummy apple-bananas and granola bars when we arrived. Would definitely stay here again...thanks guys!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "351741148",
                "date": "2018-11-23T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1069531",
                "reviewer_id": "6475045",
                "reviewer_name": "Amanda",
                "comments": "The Asia House is an incredible gem in the North Shore of Kauai. The room is just perfect for two and has everything you need for preparing simple meals. The gardens are gorgeous and the rest of the house is spectacular. The hot tub was such a great bonus after getting very wet in a storm. As is mentioned in other reviews, the wifi is spotty but can be accessed if you move closer to the main house. I would absolutely stay here again and have already recommended it to friends!"
            },

                "reviewer_name": "Patricia",
                "comments": "Amazing location, easy to drive to anywhere we wanted to go (Anini beach was our favorite). The room was smaller than I expected but it is how it is pictured. The house itself is very beautiful and relaxing."
            },

                "comments": "Coordinating the check-in time and receiving the keys was effortless and smooth which is always much appreciated. The apartment is a few minutes walk from the beaches and the shops. There is also a cafe at the end of the block which was even more convenient for morning coffee/breakfast.             {
                "_id": "116584252",
                "date": "2016-12-01T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "10423504",
                "reviewer_id": "10439717",
                "reviewer_name": "Tammy",
                "comments": "We live near Portland, Oregon in the USA and it prides itself on being hip and weird. Bondi Beach must be its sister city times two. As a bunch of aged birdwatchers we didn't really fit in but felt comfortable and accepted anyway. Lots of shops and good restaurants within easy walking distance, and the beach is just as close. There's even a funky little nine hole golf course close by. It's perched on a cliff that overlooks the ocean and has million dollar views.\n\nThe house worked well for five adults (one couple and three others) and was clean and well appointed. There are even cookbooks displayed in the kitchen in case you wanted to get adventurous. One of the bedrooms is in a guesthouse in the back yard and it was a nice place for the couple to sleep and be apart form the others. Be prepared for visiting bugs, though.\n\nBelieve Cat when she says that you won't be able to park inside the gate without a high clearance vehicle but you will be able to park in the driveway if your car is on the small side. We had a minivan that was simply too big to allow for pedestrians pushing baby strollers to get by. Parking on the street is for two hours only and the nearest long-term free parking is s few blocks away. Remember to always leave space between you and the next car as locals seem to have no issue with pinning you in if you don't. \n\nCat was great about communicating with us. She seemed available at all times, promptly answering any questions that we had.\n\nEric\nVancouver, WA \nUSA"
            },

                "comments": "This accommodation is in a lovely location, quiet close to the beach. There was some miscommunication at the beginning, but Cat was exceptional in communication and sorting matters out straight away. \nThe accommodation was very rustic with all mod cons, but in need of some refurbishment with the kitchen, which is due to be done after our visit. \nThe location is easy to get into Sydney central with good transport links. It's also close to the stadiums and Bondi Junction shopping centre.\nI would recommend this property for a relaxed stay. Thank you Cat!"

                "date": "2017-08-13T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "10423504",
                "reviewer_id": "87637542",
                "reviewer_name": "Lyn",
                "comments": "Cat's place was great, location was fantastic, a short walk to restaurants and the shops.  The corner shop cafe was very warm and welcoming and a really funky place to have a light meal or just a coffee. The house was very comfortable for a group of friends or family.  What struck us was the open plan living and plenty of lovely places to sit outside or on the porch or back deck.  Very nice.. would definetely stay again."
            },
            {
                "_id": "185154808",
                "date": "2017-08-21T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "10423504",
                "reviewer_id": "985873",
                "reviewer_name": "Katia",
                "comments": "Le logement est parfait pour 2 familles, nous étions 2 couples avec 4 enfants et l'espace était assez grand pour tout le monde et bien pensé (1 chambre en bungalow en extérieur avec douche/toilette).\nLe logement était propre (intérieur/extérieur), tout était prêt pour notre arrivée (hiver à Sydney) couettes sur les lits, bouillottes, radiateurs à disposition et la cheminée feu de bois ! génial ! (vraiment appréciable pour la saison). \nLe logement est vraiment joli, coquet. On s'y sent bien. C'est confortable (lit douillet) et bien aménagé.\nLes enfants ont appréciés l'espace extérieur, le bassin à poissons.\nLa communication avec l'hôte a été bien organisé, aucun problème pour récupérer les clés. \nLe logement est extrèmement bien situé, c'est résidentiel, calme dans le sens ou se sont surtout des familles qui y vivent, c'est près mais aussi loin de l'agitation des bars et restos...branchés de Bondi.\nEndroit très près de la plage et de l'arrêt de bus (1 min à pieds), très pratique lorsque l'on est avec des enfants. \nSympa d'être juste à côté du marché de Bondi du samedi dimanche.\nJuste le seul point qui peut être un inconvénient pour certains : l'isolation, ce n'est pas bien isolé pour l'hiver mais c'est partout pareil dans les maisons en Australie (cela doit être appréciable en été !), et pour le bruit de la route (camion poubelle) et des passants (le week end, la nuit)  aussi, la buanderie des voisins est collée à la chambre/bungalow extérieur, mais cela ne nous a pas plus dérangé, c'était vivable. \nNous recommandons vivement se logement aux familles, groupe d'amis qui souhaitent séjourner sur Sydney et plus particulièrement sur Bondi.\nMerci à l'hôte Cat, pour nous avoir permis de passer un agréable séjour dans une maison à Bondi."
            },

                "comments": "LIVE THE BONDI DREAM!  Cat's place is a private oasis in  the heart of beach-chic Bondi, only three quaint blocks to the sand (which my four-year-old insisted on completing barefoot like the locals).  It's as hip as Brooklyn but with better weather than Los Angeles and a fraction of the people,  Everything you could want is in the kitchen, and many thoughtful extras in the bathroom.             {
                "_id": "252957894",
                "date": "2018-04-13T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "10423504",
                "reviewer_id": "176298475",
                "reviewer_name": "Nicole",
                "comments": "This was the first Air bnb booking I have done and I was a bit nervous.  It was the best experience ever.  Cat is an extremely gracious hostess.  Very friendly, great communication and really thoughtful, unexpectedly offering us early check in and late check out because it was possible. \n\nThe house has a lovely friendly feel to it, and is as amazing as the pictures look, they are accurate.   Loved sitting in the beautiful courtyard, sipping champagne and enjoying the fish.\n\nSo many small attentions to detail.... having champagne stoppers, insect repellant and a really helpful guide to the house and how to navigate the surrounding areas. Lovely toiletries and an amazing open fire - yes I had the fire going, not because it was really cold, but because I love an open fire and this was one of the reasons I chose the property.  Cat was very accommodating with this and we had plenty of firewood. The fire burnt and drew well.\n\nGreat location. The house is a very easy walk to Bondi Beach, even for unfit me, and an even shorter walk to groceries, bottle shop, cafe and restaurants.\n\nParking is the only thing that is a bit awkward.  The listing description is accurate in this regard.  If you have a regular size car you will not be able to get into the driveway, which is such a shame.  We were able to get longer stay parking in other streets, but this obviously wasn't as convenient. It was doable though.\n\nWe thoroughly enjoyed our stay and intend to stay there again."
            },

                "reviewer_id": "4489874",
                "reviewer_name": "Wendy",
                "comments": "Michelle was a very considerate, responsive host. The apartment is lovely and very comfortable and was furnished with everything we needed. We had a great stay."
            },
            {
                "_id": "6868050",
                "date": "2013-08-28T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1092760",
                "reviewer_id": "6672287",
                "reviewer_name": "Eric",
                "comments": "Séjour merveilleux chez Michelle qui est une hôte adorable, le logement etait vraiment super... très propre, , fonctionnel,petit plus le rez de jardin ou l on peux manger et profiter des petits oiseaux car nous sommes à new york , mais vraiment au calme,station de metro à deux (Website hidden by Airbnb) recommande vraiment cette adresse, nous sommes venus avec nos deux enfants...\r\nMerci michelle de nous avoir permis de passer un si bon voyage,!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "7465920",
                "date": "2013-09-21T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1092760",
                "reviewer_id": "6727618",
                "reviewer_name": "Julia & Mike & Pepper",
                "comments": "I booked Michelle's private Brooklyn home for my retired parents, who were visiting me in LA from overseas and wanted to travel to New York for a few days. My parents returned from New York raving about Michelle, her graciousness and her beautiful home including a private outside patio! The apartment was attractively decorated and very clean with all the key amenities including coffeemaker, TV, internet, and even fresh fruit! The supermarket was conveniently around the corner, and my dad said he chatted with locals as he walked to the bakery to get bread each morning. My parents said it was like home away from home. They highly recommend Michelle as a host, and I can't wait to visit myself. Michelle, thank you for making my parents' New York trip so special. You and your family are welcome to visit us in Long Beach, CA anytime. \r\n\r\nMichelle, ist eine wunderbare und nette Gastgeberin.\r\nBei fragen und Tipps stets zur stelle und unglaublich hilfsbereit.\r\nDas Appartement ist sehr geräumig und voll ausgestattet.\r\nDie Lage ist erstklassig, U-Bahn und Supermarkt nicht mehr als 150 Meter entfernt.\r\nWir habe uns sehr wohl gefühlt und können uns nicht beklagen. Es ist jedem zu empfehlen der New York als Stadt erkunden will.\r\nJederzeit wieder!!\r\n"
            },
            {
                "_id": "7670947",
                "date": "2013-09-29T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1092760",
                "reviewer_id": "2759351",
                "reviewer_name": "Ilya",
                "comments": "Very nice and big enough basement apartment with two rooms. Clean and nicely furnished with a good wide bed in one room and a sofa in kitchen, with all necessary dishes and coffee machine (Michelle even provided us with coffee for it) That was much more than enough for two persons. Also we used bbq in the court which also was great. Michelle was hospitable enough to meet us in the middle of the night!  We didn`t have any problems at all living in such kind of apartment. Should notice that the connection to Mahattan is a little complicated given the G metro line which is not very frequent. But in general the enviroment is quite ok with nice dominican dely on the corner of the street (highly recomended!) "
            },

                "reviewer_id": "6108605",
                "reviewer_name": "Marcel",
                "comments": "Michelle was a nice person and really easy to communicate. We had a great time in this big apartment and no problem with to get into the city."
            },

                "_id": "7838795",
                "date": "2013-10-05T04:00:00.000Z",

                "reviewer_id": "9039463",

                "date": "2014-03-15T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1092760",
                "reviewer_id": "11182347",
                "reviewer_name": "Yann",
                "comments": "Nous rentrons d'un séjour de 8 jours à NYC où nous avons séjourn (Website hidden by Airbnb) Adultes et 2 ados) chez Michelle début mars. nous en sommes ravis malgré des températures froides.\r\n==)positifs: \r\nBon compromis rapport qualité / prix. La proximité avec une station de métro est un plus ainsi que celle de l'épicerie permettant de faire les petites courses pour les repas pris au gite. Michelle est extrêmement accueillante et serviable. \r\nl'appartement est simple et très propres. 4 vrai lits confortables. \r\n==)négatifs:\r\nbien que situé dans un quartier + calme, la chambre donne sur la rue, et les nuits peuvent être difficiles pour les oreilles sensibles. le métro qui passe dessous est audible, tout comme les avions. mais à New York , il est difficile de trouver une endroit très calme. NEW YORK reste un environnement urbain et donc globalement bruyant, autant en avoir conscience. \r\nPour une famille de 4, les lits enfants sont dans la pièce qui sert de coin jour. Une table et chaises pliantes nécessitent d'être pliés  pour installer le 4ième lit et inversement, plier le lit pour prendre les repas. Pour les français que nous sommes, la table est aussi importante que le lit. ça peut être un problème. \r\nPeu de vaisselle ( verres en plastique) ce qui est un peu dommage mais ça reste un détail.\r\nMais quand on vient à New York, ce n'est pas pour une ballade gastronomique. Nous recommandons vraiment cette adresse. Très bon compromis.\r\nLa cours arrière sera appréciable pour les périodes + douces.\r\n\r\nEnglish comments:\r\nJust returned from NYC where we stayed with our 2 teenagers in Michelle's appartement. We are really delighted .\r\n\r\n==)positives:\r\nGood compromise quality / price ratio . Proximity to a metro station is a must as well as with the grocery store allowing some errands for meals at the appartement. really practical, opened until 21h. Michelle is extremely friendly and helpful.\r\nthe appartment is simple but  very clean with 4 real comfortable beds.\r\n\r\n==)negatives:\r\nAlthough located in a quiet neighborhood, the parent room is overlooking the street, and the nights can be difficult for sensitive ears. Subway is audible,as well as cars & trucks in the street. But to moderate this aspect,  in New York, it's difficult to find a quiet place because it remains a generally noisy urban environment as knowledge.\r\nFor a family of 4, children beds are in the main room. A table and chairs need to be folded to open beds and vice versa, folding bed for meals. it could be a problem.\r\nVery few dishes ( plastic glasses ) which could be improved but it's still a detail.\r\n\r\nBut when we come to visit New York, it is not for gastronomic ballad, and it's important  to find a confortable & clean area. The backyard could be pleasant when the weather allows to use it. Unfortunatelly for us it's was too cold begining of march.\r\nWe really recommend this address.\r\nMany thanks to Michelle.\r\n\r\nPascale et Yann."

                "reviewer_name": "Cathy",
                "comments": "Très bel appartement et accueil fort sympatique de Michelle.\r\nNous étions en famille : 2 adultes et une adolescente. Grand espace : 1 chambre avec lit double (très propre et confortable) et une grande cuisine avec un canapé-lit (2 couchages). Tout était très propre et fonctionnel (cuisine en bon état et complète; salle de bain petite mais entrès bon état. Un jardin (cour intérieure) est accessible. Entrée individuelle et séparée des autres logements du petit immeuble.\r\nTrès bon rapport qualité-prix .\r\nSituation : à Brooklyn, dans le quartier de Bedford-Stuyvesant. Pas très touristique et un peu déglingué, mais très sûr et calme ; avec des petits commerces à proximité. Et l'appart de Michelle (situé à l'entresol d'un Brownston typique) est tout proche (200m env) d'une bouche de métro : la G , qui va au nord vers le Queens (arrêt proche Metropolitan Ave : quartier Bobo de Bedford-Williamsburg, très sympa) et au sud vers les quartiers animés de Brooklyn (ex. arrêt Bergen str. : Cobben Hill et Carroll garden). Enfin la ligne G permet la correspondance aves la ligne A, qui va à l'est vers JFK-airport et vers l'ouest : à Manhattan -ligne \"express\".\r\nMerci beaucoup à Michelle pour sa gentillesse et son bel appartement, où nous avons passé 8 jours superbes fin août 2014 !!"
            },

            {
                "_id": "20546722",
                "date": "2014-10-01T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1092760",

            {
                "_id": "21502904",
                "date": "2014-10-19T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1092760",
                "reviewer_id": "13774639",
                "reviewer_name": "Rene Buch",
                "comments": "Vi have et rigtig dejligt ophold i Michelles lejlighed i Brooklyn. Vi er 2 voksne og tre store børn. Lejligheden var ren og pæn, med alle de ting en familie har brug for. Godt lille køkken, hvor vi hver dag kunne lave morgenmad, kaffe og te. Dertil en rigtig hyggelig gårdhave, hvor man kan slappe af efter en hektisk dag på Manhattan. Kvarteret hvor lejligheden ligger i er et beboelseskvarter, med masser af butikker, restauranter, skoler og kirker. Et levende område, men meget trygt og vi følte os meget sikre når vi gik rundt. Vi var glade for, at vi valgte at bo i Brooklyn, for der er meget at se og opleve i området. Michelles lejlighed ligger kun 30 meter fra en subway, og det er enkelt at finde til Manhattan eller andre steder på Brooklyn. Vores fly var forsinket, og vi ankom først kl. 01 til lejligheden, men Michelle var meget omtænksom og havde lagt vand og juice i køleskabet, og sørget for at der var kaffe. Så kunne vi lige klare os til næste morgen, hvor vi handlede ind i supermarkedet - tak for det Michelle.\r\n\r\nI det hele taget gjorde Michelle det nemt at være turist i New York. Hun var tilgængelig for vores spørgsmål og da vi skulle hjem, bestilte hun en taxa til os. Lejligheden, området og Michelle gav vores efterårsferie til en særlig oplevelse for os alle fem, og vi vil varmt anbefale andre at bo hos Michelle."
            },

            {

                "reviewer_id": "19602331",
                "reviewer_name": "Michael",
                "comments": "We did feel welcome and there was a nice note with some good tips on things close and help getting around. That being said, DO NOT turn the water just to hot to wash your hands, you will get burnt. Our flight got in late at night and when we arrived, it smelled like a bug bomb was let off in the apartment. We aired it out every day and it took almost 3 days for the odor to dissipate. Michelle said it was cleaners, I am still unsure. My wife and I both got a headache from the fumes the first night.  The bed in the photo is a misrepresentation, the mattress was a sleep number set to the hardest setting with no remote to adjust it, we slept on the couch/daybed. The pillows were cheap and nearly unusable, bring your own. The sheets were also cheap, hospital quality. There are 14 signs in the apartment and on the door to the back telling you what you are and aren't allowed to do. We had to call to have the heat turned on when it was about 40 degrees in the space and then the radiators are quite noisy and right near the bed.\r\n\r\n45 minute commute on the subway to get to mid-town Manhattan. I would not stay there again, we never felt really comfortable. "

                "comments": "Me sentí EXCELENTE en la casa de Michelle. Le daria un 10/10. Es muy limpio, bonito, espacioso y full equipado con todo ( inlcuso secador de  pelo, spray de cabello, toallas, platos, cubiertos, libros, dos televisores LCD, guias de NYC, un jardin hermoso, TODO!) se tiene privacidad y el vecindario es muy bonito, aunque recomiendo tener cuidado y no llegar a media noche para prevenir cualquier incidente, ya que un taxista nos dijo que a media noche podrúa no ser tan seguro) \r\nEl Subway esta en la esquina de la cuadra y  toma media hora para llegar a Lower Manhattan y 40 minutos a el Midtown, ademas el precio me parece justo.                 "date": "2015-01-02T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1092760",
                "reviewer_id": "9748784",
                "reviewer_name": "Rhiannon",
                "comments": "We really enjoyed our 9 nights in this cosy apartment, and Michelle is a warm, friendly and considerate hostess. She had stocked the fridge with essentials like juice, eggs, butter and jam, and the cupboards also had a lot of basics like tea, coffee, pasta etc. Likewise there was plenty of soap, toilet paper, shampoo and body wash in the bathroom, none of which we had ever seen in previous Air BnB apartments. Little touches like this really make a difference if you've ever forgotten your own, or if you don't have a lot of time to spend shopping.\n\nFor a couple, the apartment is spacious, warm, comfortable and extremely close to a subway station with supermarkets and delicatessens in easy walking distance. It's very easy to get into Manhattan within about 40 minutes.\n\nMichelle was extremely accommodating, had lots of good tips about the local area and the rest of NYC, and the next time we are in NYC, I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again. It definitely felt like our home away from home in New York! Thanks, Michelle - we really enjoyed our stay with you :0)"

            {
                "_id": "25085350",
                "date": "2015-01-06T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1092760",
                "reviewer_id": "13285322",
                "reviewer_name": "Elie",
                "comments": "Michelle is a warm and friendly host. She welcomed my family and explained everything thoroughly - all the amenities, how the heating works, street parking rules and what is to be found in the neighbourhood. \r\nThe unit itself is cozy and beautifully decorated. Main bed is comfortable and sofa bed with pull out trundle is also comfy. Michelle also has a baby's portable cot so the unit can easily accommodate 2 adults and 2 small children. \r\nHeating is great which is important in the brutal NY winter. \r\nKitchen amenities are also good if you want to prepare your own meals. Kitchen is fully equipped with fridge, cooktop, microwave, coffee maker, kettle, pots and pans etc. Closest supermarket is a couple of minutes walk away. It is small but stocks a great variety of produce and organic food options (good for us vegans). \r\nNeighbourhood feels safe enough and not noisy. Subway is also a minute away and the train ride to Manhattan takes roughly 15-20 minutes with a change of trains. \r\nOther things to mention: shower is nice - good stream; good wi-fi; cable tv; glass doors to separate bedroom from living area;  which contains the pull-out sofa; well baby-proofed. \r\nOverall, no complaints. We are very happy customers and highly recommend Michelle and her lovely unit. Would happily stay here again. Thank you Michelle x"
            },
            {
                "_id": "25784596",
                "date": "2015-01-26T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1092760",
                "reviewer_id": "20084539",
                "reviewer_name": "Laura",
                "comments": "Michelle was extremely warm and welcoming. She meet us at the entrance and explained to us everything about the apartment. The apartment was toasty once we arrived, and set up just like the photos. Extremely clean and well stocked. I stayed with three friends for 6 nights and though the apartment is small in square footage, it is very spacious because of the way the apartment is set. We were able to have the table with the four chairs up the whole time we were there and managed to move around freely. We definitely took advantage of the kitchen, we cooked every morning. The apartment is located half a block down from the G line which was great since we took the train everywhere. She gave us a list of recommendations, make sure you go to the Black Swan. They have great food and beers. The apartment has central heating so make sure to take a tank top because it is warm at night. We all overpacked because we thought the apartment might of been too cold because of the snow but it was nice and toasty. We did see snow fall down and it was nice to have the patio in the back to make snow angels. Michelle is extremely attentive and if you really want to enjoy New York, stay out in Brooklyn. Definitely give this place a chance, it's worth it. "

                "comments": "Empfehlenswerte Unterkunft, Brooklyn ist toll mit trendy und coolen Vierteln. \r\nDie Wohnung entspricht den Fotos, sie ist sehr sauber, Küche gut ausgestattet, der Garten ist gemütlich. Es bestand wenig Kontakt, dafür war die Privatsphäre gewährleistet. Die Lage der Unterkunft ist praktisch, da ÖV In der Nähe. Sämtliche Sehenswürdigkeiten sind mit der Subway gut erreichbar.\r\nBei einem erneuten NY-Besuch würde ich als Ausgangspunkt immer wieder Brooklyn wählen. Nach hektischem und ereignisreichem Sightseeing in Manhattan, war es jeweils erholsam wieder in eine ruhigere Gegend \"nach Hause\" zu fahren. Zudem gibt es dort trendy Shops, gemütliche Kaffees, freundliche, hilfsbereite und multikulturelle Bevölkerung usw.\r\n"
            },
            {
                "_id": "50750208",
                "date": "2015-10-14T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1092760",
                "reviewer_id": "35309907",
                "reviewer_name": "Diederik",
                "comments": "We want to thank Michelle for the great stay the past week. We had a very nice welcome which started with instructions how to get from the airport to the apartment (metro or taxi). When we arrived early, Michelle was waiting and showed us around the house and garden, explaining the house rules etc. She also had a nice folder with food menu's and things to do in the area.\r\n\r\nLocation and area were great, first of all it's really only a two minute walk to the nearest metro station, which gets you into Manhattan/Times Square within 25 minutes. The rest of the area is very convenient and pretty cool as well. There is a Dunkin Donut on the corner, as well as a KFC for breakfast lunch or dinner. For groceries there is a little supermarket also just around the corner.\r\n\r\nWe actually walked from the apartment to Manhattan over the Brooklyn Bridge, all the way through Brooklyn which we found a great experience. Another great stop from the apartment is Coney Island, also in Brooklyn, which has one of the oldest/longest boardwalks in the country. Great atmosphere and amazing food!\r\n\r\nThe apartment itself was very stylish with a lot of personal touches and Michelle made it feel like a home from home with towels, toilet paper and other pleasant surprises. The kitchen is fully stocked with crockery, pots, pans and cutlery  and there is cable and WiFi! The garden is also great, very private and relaxing if you like to sit outside.\r\n\r\nAll in all we highly recommend this apartment. "
            },

                "date": "2016-07-04T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1092760",
                "reviewer_id": "70780151",
                "reviewer_name": "Michelle",
                "comments": "Michelle kept in touch from the moment we booked to time of arrival, she was really organised and was at the apartment to welcome us, after a tour of the apartment and a run down of the area, we were left to complete privacy although when needed Michelle was always available (Website hidden by Airbnb) The apartment was even better than described it was so comfortable spotlessly clean, & extremely well equipt there wasnt much we could have asked for it was our home away from home (Website hidden by Airbnb) The location was good most things are very close walking distance  Brooklyn is a friendly neighbourhood  with convenience stores restaurants & weekend markets during summer,  the parks and around Brooklyn bridge are really nice so hiring a bike is also a popular thing to do,  the Metro station is a 2 min walk & once on the Metro 25 min to NY (Website hidden by Airbnb) We were so glad we chose the Brooklyn area and we fell in love with the apartment so much that we hope we will get to stay again sometime."

            {

                "date": "2016-07-24T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1092760",
                "reviewer_id": "64745629",
                "reviewer_name": "Jean-Paul",
                "comments": "Michelle was on premises to welcome me and provide me with the keys and all required information.  She has been a great host, easy to reach and very responsive (she lives upstairs).  At the time of departure she was there as well and allowed me to leave my luggage in her hall so that I could freely enjoy my last hours in town before my late flight at JFK.\r\nThe appartment is cosy and well furnished.  It isn't very big (hey, this is NYC) but 4 guests are at ease and there is a garden (with table, chairs, arbor,...) which doubles the available surface!\r\nThree drawbacks, though:\r\n- there is no microwave anymore in the kitchen;\r\n- there is no window nor ventilation in the bathroom, thus the towels never really dry if left there;\r\n- the master bed is in the frontroom of the house (read next).\r\nThe house is located in a 2 lanes avenue, which means that it is quite noisy due to cars (sometimes with loud music), trucks, buses and even the subway running beneath.\r\nBut the location is perfect if you need access to public transportation, as there is an entrance to the subway at each end of the block as well as a couple of bus lines : travel to Brooklyn, Manhattan, Queens and even JFK is easy.\r\nThere are several restaurants, supermarkets, delis, laundries, banks... and the neighborhood is safe.\r\nOverall, it's a great urban spot with an excellent host !"

                "reviewer_id": "97651800",
                "reviewer_name": "Alain",
                "comments": "appartement fonctionnel et confortable, idéal pour 3 à 4 personnes, commerces a proximité, propriétaire a l'écoute, discrète et sympathique.\nquartier tranquille qui change du brouhaha de Manhattan\nmétro a proximité (20 mn de times square)\n"

            {
                "_id": "146352782",
                "date": "2017-04-22T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1092760",
                "reviewer_id": "72726132",
                "reviewer_name": "Jeroen",
                "comments": "Well equipped, clean apartment hosted by the lovely Michelle, who responded quickly whenever we had questions for her, with the intention to help out as well as possible. Definitely a great addition to the Airbnb community.\n\nThe apartment is situated near a subway station in the Bedford-Stuyvesant neighbourhood, of which it does become apparent quickly enough that it has had a rocky past, but me and my girlfriend haven't felt unsafe for a single second.\n\nSome practical things that could be handy to know...\n\n* If you're used to silence when you go to sleep, you may experience some difficulties here. We haven't heard any construction going on during our week in New York City, but traffic does go on until pretty late, and you'll hear it a bit when a subway train is passing by. Luckily the ear plugs Michelle has provided help well, and the bed is very comfortable.\n\n* Unrelated to the apartment, but still something I'd like to share for possible future guests to keep into consideration; Brooklyn doesn't have an awful lot of Walmart like supermarkets. There are plenty of delis, but those usually don't have a wide array of products, especially when you prefer to eat healthy. So you'll basically have to be in Manhattan for the higher end supermarkets, and those tend to be very pricey, and you're more or less scr*wed if you're a vegetarian/vegan. Guess you'll have to visit specialty shops for that.\n\n* When it's warm enough, do use that garden. :)"
            },
            {

                "reviewer_id": "21793715",
                "reviewer_name": "Pnina",
                "comments": "To our opinion Michelle fulfills the vision of Airbnb of bringing people together.\nThe moment you walk in and meet her you feel home, reliability, caring and tons of good will. Michelle helped us, shared information and her generosity shows all over.\nWe were invited to use food that waited for us in the fridge and in the kitchen. Plenty of towels, blankets and all the other stuff. All our requests were fully filled with a big smile.\nThe name of the apparent is correctly describing: great transportation- a two minute walk to the subway station and the garden which adds space, blue sky and the possibility to relax, eat or just stay in and out at the same time."
            },

                "comments": "My daughter and I stayed at Michelle's place in Brooklyn and she is a wonderful host.             {
                "_id": "251248626",
                "date": "2018-04-07T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1092760",
                "reviewer_id": "11550749",
                "reviewer_name": "Carol",
                "comments": "This was my first time at an Airbnb. I'm so glad a chose this place. It was truly a home away from home experience. It was a clean and lovely decorated apartment. We did not get to use the outside space/backyard because it was cold, but it's a lovely space with sitting areas and grill. Michelle anticipated all our needs. The place was fully stocked with all necessities. The location was within walking distance to train and bus.             {
                "_id": "8239390",
                "date": "2013-10-21T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "5868092",
                "reviewer_name": "Yury",
                "comments": "Our stay at Aloha Beach House was very nice. It really looks like on the pictures. The house is equipped with a lot of stuff that one might ever need for vacation: kayaks, tennis table, board games, TV with Netflix subscription, freezer with ice maker, etc.\r\n\r\nLynn, the house manager, was very welcoming and helpful. She made a nice intro when we arrived and tried to do whatever necessary to make our stay more pleasant. When we found ants in the kitchen, we told Lynn, and the next day the problem was solved.\r\n\r\nThe drawback I can think of is the lack of sound proofness, so when somebody goes to a bathroom it can be heard from the neighboring room. It was not a big deal though, since we rented the whole house.\r\n\r\nWe really enjoyed our stay at Aloha Beach House. Thank you, Cheryl and Lynn!!\r\n"
            },
            {
                "_id": "9008719",
                "date": "2013-12-01T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "8298993",
                "reviewer_name": "Phil",
                "comments": "If you ever wanted to stay in a lava-field - THAT's the place to stay - the atmosphere around the house is just so special and one of the quitest places i've ever been - cheryl makes sure that you'll get all the informations you need and makes everything that you feel at home - a bbq on the huuuuge lanai is a must!!!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "9194211",
                "date": "2013-12-12T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "9234335",
                "reviewer_name": "LoriAnn",
                "comments": "We had a wonderful stay at Cheryl's Aloha Beach House.  The house is FULLY stocked with anything imaginable, including coolers, kayaks, snorkels, linens, and even coffee! We found the location to be a great launching point to go to Kona and Hilo.  The house is situated near a historic fishing village and is on a lava field in a quiet community.  Don't let the trip down from the highway intimidate you, just take it slow, the end result is so worth the few miles of curvy road.  The view of the Pacific was amazing!  Cheryl and Lynn were so accommodating and even worked with us so we could stay an extra night.  They provided tips on where to go and helped orient us to the island.  When we come back to the Big Island, we will definitely stay at the Aloha Beach House.  We hope to be back soon. "
            },
            {
                "_id": "9347217",
                "date": "2013-12-23T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "6743706",
                "reviewer_name": "Sophie",
                "comments": "My parents, my husband and I had a great stay at Cheryl's house. It's very clean and cozy. It looks exactly like the picture or even better. We could see the ocean from the living room and the kitchen. There is a huge collection of movies and games too. Lynn, the manager, is very nice and helpful. She gave us some very good information for us to plan our trip and shared some great storied from her own experience. She recommend an awesome bakery on our way to the volcano park. She also helped fix the TV promptly. The location is a little far from the popular area. But it was not a issue for us since my husband is a good driver and the view from the house and the house itself just offset the little inconvenience. We recommend this place to anyone who want to visit the big island and we hope to visit again the next time."
            },
            {
                "_id": "9522701",
                "date": "2014-01-01T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "10156884",
                "reviewer_name": "Meena",
                "comments": "Thank you Cheryl and Lynn for your beautifully decorated and cozy beach side abode! :) It was a great vacation spot. Would recommend for families or groups of tourists looking for an isolated but picturesque place to stay :)"
            },
            {
                "_id": "9782981",
                "date": "2014-01-10T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "7428458",
                "reviewer_name": "Maia",
                "comments": "Aloha Beach House was in a beautiful, quiet setting on a lava field.  A bit off the beaten path- but exactly as pictured.  Three bedroom three bath gives everyone some privacy.  The downstairs bed/bath was my favorite because I could hear the ocean waves crashing.  The hosts have just about everything!  DVDs, Netflix, ice chests, boogie boards, kayaks.  They have a rec room with table tennis and pool table.  The outdoor lanai is great for BBQs and watching sunsets.  Great hosts- very prompt with communications and manager was around daily to answer questions.  About an hour from Kona and an hour and a half from Volcano."
            },
            {
                "_id": "9862516",
                "date": "2014-01-15T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "95009",
                "reviewer_name": "Carsten",
                "comments": "Very nice house with an excellent view to the ocean. The property is designed and equipped for rentals. You'll even find snorkeling gear, finns and beach shoes. \r\nI can definitely recommend this place."
            },
            {
                "_id": "9916521",
                "date": "2014-01-19T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "10949957",
                "reviewer_name": "Elizabeth",
                "comments": "This house is a HOME! And I felt so lucky to be able to share it! Thank you Cheryl and Lynn! For those of you who have never been to the Big Island, it is not the white sand beaches of postcards - but it is AMAZINGLY beautiful. This house sits in a field of lava overlooking dramatic cliffs. The drive down the hill is not for someone like my other (who is terrified of hights) but I loved driving it.  One of the best beaches on the island is only a 10 minute drive and 20 minute hike away, but be aware, you all have to drive to anywhere on this island. We brought some clothing detergent and left it and some salt and paper, we also left a card for the Big Island Chocolate Store frequent buyer card so the next people can take advantage of it and get some free chocolate. Spread the love if you come!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "10226345",
                "date": "2014-02-07T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "8884057",
                "reviewer_name": "Liam",
                "comments": "Lovely property in remote area. Perfect if you are looking to get away as there are no stores within a half hour radius. We didn't actually end up staying at the house as were wanted to be around people, beaches, clubs, restaurants and bars. Lynn, the property manager was very helpful and Cheryl, the owner was very understanding in allowing us to leave without penalty. \r\nPros: \r\nBig spacious house with panoramic deck.\r\nBike, pool table and washer/dryer in basement. \r\nNice view of the water \r\nNeat interior design \r\nWhale Watching 30 seconds from house \r\n45min -1hr from South Point, Green/Black Sand Beach\r\nCons: \r\nNo stores nearby, takes 15 min to drive up the hill\r\nPay for Wifi\r\nTV is Roku, not live \r\nNo AC, But fans in each room and breeze from outside \r\nA lot of mosquitoes in the area.\r\n\r\nOverall, I really liked the house itself but not so much the area. \r\nHowever, it really depends on what kind of vacation you are looking for. \r\n \r\nThank You Cheryl"
            },
            {
                "_id": "10758208",
                "date": "2014-03-06T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "6582377",
                "reviewer_name": "Andrea",
                "comments": "We had a lovely time at Cheryl's house to celebrate my parents' 50th anniversary (she even arranged a bottle of wine, which was a very thoughtful touch!).  The house is really beautiful and is exactly as described and pictured.  Lynn, the manager, was very nice and accommodating. \r\n\r\nBe sure to follow the recommendations from Cheryl and the other reviewers.  Bring your food and drinks with you and be careful in planning your outings so you don't have to go up and down the hill too many times.  I was terrified driving down the hill for the first time (despite the breathtaking views!) b/c I was convinced we'd never get our rental minivan back up the switchbacks on the winding narrow road, but it really wasn't a problem."
            },
            {
                "_id": "10875093",
                "date": "2014-03-11T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "5003910",
                "reviewer_name": "Helen",
                "comments": "great house, great location, amazing view of the ocean, beautiful stargazing at night. we had a fantastic stay. wish i was still sitting out on the lanai. thanks cheryl!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "12721031",
                "date": "2014-05-09T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "1640453",
                "reviewer_name": "Everett",
                "comments": "Pros:\r\nCheryl and her manager Lynn were both very communicative and kind. The house was clean and spacious, had a wide deck, and plenty of snorkel/ocean gear. The neighborhood is very quiet and the houses set apart. Homolino beach is a short drive and mild walk away, and is very secluded and beautiful.\r\n\r\nCons:\r\nThe property is on a big lava flow area, which is a cool vibe (feels like Mars) but not a lush part of Hawaii. Also, the swim/snorkel area 1.5 blocks away is not a beach (its a rocky lava shore) and not the safest feeling -- Homolino is great though, as are other places you can drive to. Finally, Cheryl openly admits this, but it is really far from stores, restaurants, etc (30-60m depending). Just things to keep in mind."
            },
            {
                "_id": "12922291",
                "date": "2014-05-14T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "9052083",
                "reviewer_name": "Devon",
                "comments": "The house was great. Very clean and spacious. Beautiful ocean views and falling asleep to the sound of the waves every night cannot be beat! The location is really unique and amazing. \r\n\r\nIt was in a nice, secluded neighborhood with fairly easy access to local beaches. The south end of the island is a beautiful place to explore, especially if you are looking for a relaxing, quiet vacation away from the traditional touristy Hawaii.\r\n\r\nThe road down to the house was a bit steep and winding, but it's well paved and we didn't have any issues. It does take a bit of time to get in or out of the neighborhood on this road since you have to drive slow.\r\n\r\nCommunication with the host was prompt, friendly, and helpful. Very easy to communicate back and forth with any questions we had during our stay."
            },
            {
                "_id": "13647768",
                "date": "2014-06-02T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "6562329",
                "reviewer_name": "Petr",
                "comments": "Cheryl, thank you very much for this vacation. Very nice house. Lots of space, huge lanai. Coral fish 5 minutes by walk from the house. Free to use: snorkling gear, washer and dryer, stove, fridge with ice maker... everything works fine. House is located in secluded location right at the ocean. Island itself is amazing: we drove everywhere: Waipio valley (twice!), Waimea, Hapuna beach (nice sand beach), Kahaluu beach (best snorkling beach), Hookena beach, Hilo, Kona, waterfalls,  Volcano park, Mauna Kea. Dolphin tour is must see! Only thing is that house does not have A/C (still have lots of fans in every room), so if  you stay in the house all day it might be little uncomfortable (at least it was for us those 2 days we did not go anywhere), but you won't find A/C in most places anyway.  \r\nIt was the best vacation we have ever had! Thank you! P.S Mangos are delicous in Hawaii! Ate them everyday, never got tired!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "14686434",
                "date": "2014-06-24T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "3340675",
                "reviewer_name": "Carey",
                "comments": "Second time staying at the Aloha Beach House and will book again for the next trip to The Big Island. Wonderful retreat from the typical touristy places and easy to get to. Easy drive from Kona Airport with a quick stop at Target (or Wal-Mart across the highway) for food supplies before driving south to Miloli'i. We always stop at the South Kona Fruit Stand for smoothies before arriving at the Aloha Beach House. Amazing snorkeling in Honomalino Bay (get there early and you'll be treated to hours of entertainment by dolphins with no one else around). Quick drive over to Volcano National Park and super easy to all other attractions the Big Island has to offer. When you return to the Beach House, fire up the grill for dinner and enjoy your delicious Hawaiian meal on the deck. The Beach House is comfortable year-round, even without A/C (we've stayed in March and June). Don't miss the phenomenal sunsets that can be seen from the deck, as well as from inside! "
            },
            {
                "_id": "15405991",
                "date": "2014-07-08T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "16044770",
                "reviewer_name": "Jens",
                "comments": "We (family with three young kids) just had some wonderful days at Aloha Beach.
