We loved to snorkel and see an amazing colorful underwater world only 2 min away from the house. We would come back anytime. If you don't look for overcrowded places and beaches we can strongly recommend to stay there for quite and relaxing holidays"
            },
            {
                "_id": "16440244",
                "date": "2014-07-27T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "13994783",
                "reviewer_name": "Clinton",
                "comments": "What a wonderful house!  Cheryl's place is clean, comfortable, spacious and comes with amazing views from the wraparound deck.  A quick walk down the road and you're in the water swimming, snorkeling or kayaking in what might as well be your own private cove on the Big Island.  If you're looking for a nice quiet place to relax and slow things down this is a great place to do it.  "
            },
            {
                "_id": "17993078",
                "date": "2014-08-20T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "10741411",
                "reviewer_name": "Sophie",
                "comments": "We had a fantastic time at the Aloha Beach House. The welcome was warm with Daniel looking after us and showing us the kayaks and beach gear (which we put to good use around the bays near Captain Cook). The design of the house allows for some fantastic sea breezes meaning we didn't over heat and some of the best snorkelling was just down the road in the bay itself! The house is very comfortable and well stocked with dvds and netflix. A very relaxing stay and a definite recommendation!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "19266487",
                "date": "2014-09-09T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "3434228",
                "reviewer_name": "Anna",
                "comments": "Our stay at the aloha beach house was just wonderful.  The house was well appointed; we had everything we needed and more, with attentive care from both our hosts and from Daniel, who lives next door and was just a phone call away.  The house was surprisingly cool with all the sliding glass doors and fans.  Even after being closed up in the heat, it cooled off quickly upon our return in the evening.  We loved the location, since it was off the beaten path, giving us easy access to explore places that may not be seen by most visitors to the big island.  We loved jumping in the water first thing in the morning.  There is an easy place to hop in and enjoy world class snorkeling just a two minute walk away, and with snorkel gear provided, as well as boogie boards and kayaks, exploration is a must.  We highly recommend this house to anyone looking for a vacation away from the resorts and standard tourist fare.  Although we were two couples, it was obvious the house would be great for kids and adults alike.  Thanks, Cheryl, for making our stay on the big island memorable and relaxing."
            },
            {
                "_id": "19364470",
                "date": "2014-09-11T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "3458299",
                "reviewer_name": "Jessica",
                "comments": "Comfort. Awesome views. Quiet.\n\nThese are the things we were looking for after nearly two weeks of active exploring. \n\nWe would love to come back.\n\nTips: there is plenty of cooking oil, basic spices, coffee/tea and drinking water. Groceries are 30 mins away so stock up. If the swimming hole is too deep/rough, head north down the main road to great wading and snorkeling."
            },
            {
                "_id": "19517513",
                "date": "2014-09-14T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "12904668",
                "reviewer_name": "Karoline",
                "comments": "The house is wonderful! Nicely furnished, lots of space. A quiet and peaceful place! We loved the ocean view. It's only a 5 min. walk to a bay where you can snorkel. Cheryl was very helpful although she doesn't live in the area."
            },
            {
                "_id": "21698160",
                "date": "2014-10-22T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "15541635",
                "reviewer_name": "Jake",
                "comments": "The house was nice! We had fun playing games in the basement (having a washing machine on our trip was also a bonus) and settling down to some netflix after a long day's adventures to relax with the screen doors open.\r\nThe swimming area is neat (it is not a beach, but a rocky area you walk down directly to the water and has a home-made bridge and railing to keep your balance) and all the snorkeling equipment is available with the rental!\r\nThe biggest issue with the house is that it is located at the bottom of a large hill/cliff with very, very steep roads. We didn't mind driving a while to the nearby towns (Kona is ~1 hour away) but the road down to the house is pretty rough and at points it's nearly 1 lane wide, which is a little scary when there are also other people trying to get up or down the hill. It also takes about 15-20 minutes to drive up or down it. Yikes!\r\nAll in all, we had a good time at the house. Mahalo!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "23572097",
                "date": "2014-12-05T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "21381254",
                "reviewer_name": "Emma",
                "comments": "The house is fabulous, Cheryl is a great host, the location wasn't for us. \r\n\r\nCheryl was a great host. Good communications, and friendly. Great to have bottled water supplied in the heat of Hawaii! \r\n\r\nThe house is amazing. Spacious, comfy, well equipped. A fantastic holiday home for a couple getting away, a group having an adventure, or a family spending time together. The kind of house you could settle into for a few weeks, and not feel cramped. \r\n\r\nThe location is good in some ways. It is between Kona and the volcano, which means you could explore in either direction. But it wasn't what we were looking for. I should have done more research. \r\n\r\nWe wanted surf, easy swimming, and not a lot of driving. We were only in Hawaii for five days, and wanted some R&R. We couldn't easily access the water from here, and needed to drive to explore. Other reviewers didn't seem to have this problem, and certainly the guest book in the host was full of glowing reviews from people who had a great time and swam nearby very happily. \r\n\r\nWe actually ended up leaving after one night, instead of the booked three. Only because we didn't do enough research before booking, and the location didn't suit us. As I said, the house is great, Cheryl is great, and the location will suit some people really well. Just not us. "
            },
            {
                "_id": "24135327",
                "date": "2014-12-21T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "21969068",
                "reviewer_name": "Ben",
                "comments": "The house was just as beautiful and comfortable as we'd expected! And even more spacious than it looks online. Daniel the neighbor came by to tell us about the best spots to visit in the area. The house (and the whole neighborhood) is on one big lava flow. There is next to no traffic and also next to no lights at night, which made for incredible star gazing. I could spend forever sleeping to the sound of the surf from this house! Honomalino Beach (just a short drive and hike from the house) was the best, most private beach we visited on the Big Island. And the house is stocked with all the beach toys you could need! The game room looked fun, but we were too busy having fun outside to ever use it. Can't wait to go back!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "25398329",
                "date": "2015-01-14T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "664964",
                "reviewer_name": "Brian",
                "comments": "It is all about the Toilet paper. \r\n\r\nIf you don't read anything else in this review, understand that the toilet paper provided at the Makai Hideaway is really good quality paper, it exemplifies the attention to detail that Cheryl put into her home, and the hospitality in the small details that makes a big difference between just a rental and an amazing home. \r\n-----\r\nWe loved our stay at Cheryl's place! We felt incredibly privileged that she shares her wonderful home. \r\n\r\nFirst, the location: One of the things that the Big Island is known for is its volcanoes and lava. Other than seeing actual flowing lava (which wasn't possible during our stay), one can pretty much experience the same at the seaside house. The house is on actual lava flow and one can see and experience the lava field the community is built upon. In addition, one can see and hear the ocean and the beautiful coastline from the house. There is a small black sand beach less than 20 minutes away as well as another swimming/snorkeling location less than 5 minutes (walking!) away. In short, the location is beautiful!\r\n\r\nHospitality: It is the little things that count: an up-to-date 2014 travel guide for the Big Island that we brought with us on our daily excursions, Hawaiian music CDs, DVDs, wifi, kitchen utensils, bowls and everything else you'd need to cook, laundry room, game room, water fun activity stuff...we really couldn't have asked for anything more during our stay. \r\n\r\nThe process: Cheryl was very responsive to our request to book, even though we contacted her last minute. She is very friendly and answered all of our questions promptly. Her directions were excellent, we had no problem finding the house at night. Daniel the local caretaker is a fount of local information, providing tips on what is worth the time and money and what is just a tourist trap. \r\n\r\nOther miscellaneous thoughts: the house is a ways away from the main tourist area of Kona, which is great because you can enjoy your stay away from tourists. Also, the house is great value to share with some friends as there are plenty of sleeping places. \r\n"
            },
            {
                "_id": "26175667",
                "date": "2015-02-06T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "21506963",
                "reviewer_name": "Nicholas",
                "comments": "We loved the house!  Plenty of space to sit and relax (although we were usually out and about) and the extra goodies (kayaks, snorkeling gear, boogie boards) were so great to have.  Don't worry about bringing snorkel gear as there are about ten full sets.\n\nAs previous reviews suggested, the house is a bit out of the way (roughly an hour south of Kona and fifteen minutes down a winding road of switchbacks).  This was not too big a deal for us since it's the Big Island and we knew we would be doing a lot of driving.\n\nThere are four beds in the house and a few additional sleeping spaces (a futon, air mattress, and sofa bed).  We had 8 adults, and not all were couples, so it was a tad constricting.  One was in the futon and another in the air mattress.  Not too bad for the week we were there, but any additional time might have seemed cramped.\n\nCheryl is great at communication leading up to the trip.  I had several questions and she usually responded within minutes.\n\nDaniel, who watches over the house since Cheryl doesn't live in the area, is a treasure trove of information.  He is very fun and loves to help with any planning.\n\nOverall, I highly recommend the house.  Just make sure it is the right fit for your size group and what you're wanting to do."
            },
            {
                "_id": "26515772",
                "date": "2015-02-15T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "20168389",
                "reviewer_name": "Lee",
                "comments": "We thoroughly enjoyed our family reunion at Aloha Beach House. There were 3 bedrooms and 3 bathrooms, and a full kitchen. We stocked up food at Costco & Choicemart, and ate gourmet meals every night. The lanai is large and comfy, and with fans and the breeze we didn't need AC.  Miloli is in a fairly isolated location, but that also is a positive if you aren't looking for hordes of tourists (we weren't), and it is much closer to the Volcano Park than other places on the Kona side. Cheryl was great to work with and very attentive to our needs. Daniel the host is very welcoming, and so are the other neighbors. The ocean is fabulous there, crashing surf vs.lava.  The house is accommodating and comfy, and cutely decorated. The ping-pong table was well-used by us, as was the kitchen.  The price was very reasonable for everything provided.  Overall, a great week - thanks, Cheryl ! "
            },
            {
                "_id": "26854449",
                "date": "2015-02-21T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "4128675",
                "reviewer_name": "Alexandra",
                "comments": "Cheryl was very accommodating  and made us feel very welcome at her house.  We needed a playpen for our baby and she made sure it was there when we arrived.  The house was very clean and had plenty of games, such as ping pong table and billiard/hockey table to occupy all of our 4 kids.  There was also lots of water gear which we were grateful to have for our trips to the beach.  We especially enjoyed the spacious lanai where we had all our meals.  The house has a great view of the ocean and we were able to watch wales breaching in the evenings through binoculars provided by Cheryl.  It is a very comfortable house and there is always a nice cooling breeze on the lanai.  "
            },
            {
                "_id": "27394469",
                "date": "2015-03-03T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "6798212",
                "reviewer_name": "Irina",
                "comments": "We felt like we are at our summer house. It has everything for comfortable stay and even more. We liked the place, sunny, close to the ocean (no sandy beach like everywhere on Big Island, but good enough to swim), just 100 meters from rocky steps to the ocean. One thing made us upset - this place is really far from everything and to get there you drive from the highway down along mountain serpentine for 5 miles. For a short stay is not convenient, good for a long relaxing vacation."
            },
            {
                "_id": "27710142",
                "date": "2015-03-10T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "21467305",
                "reviewer_name": "Ron",
                "comments": "Cheryl was an excellent host. She kept us informed via email as to what was going on, lava flow activity, and general weather. We had zero problems.\r\n\r\nThe house itself is great. While there were only four of us on this trip, the house could easily accommodate twice that many. The beds were comfortable, the bathrooms well stocked with shampoo, soap, sunscreen, ointments, etc., and the view of the ocean off the front lanai was excellent.\r\n\r\nThe kitchen is well stocked with everything you need to make good food, and the living area has comfortable furniture and even amenities like Netflix.\r\n\r\nThe caretaker, \"Uncle\" Dan, was friendly and outgoing. He is also a fount of local information, and he gave us directions to an excellent local beach. This beach is hard to get to, but is fantastic.\r\n\r\nThe house also has just about everything you need for an island stay: many pairs of snorkels and flippers, kayaks, body boards, water shoes, and numerous other stuff to make your stay pleasant. The fact that you are a one minute walk from excellent snorkeling in the bay doesn't, hurt, either.\r\n\r\nThe listing is very accurate, and the photos match the house. The house itself is very nicely appointed with nice art and colours. It didn't feel like we were invading anyone's personal space, and it was very comfortable.\r\n\r\nThe only \"drawback\" has more to do with the island itself than the house. It is fairly remote, and it takes a lot of driving to get anywhere. Not that distances as so far: you can only drive about 35 mph / 60 km/h, so it takes a while to get anywhere. The twisty roads take some getting used to, especially for a Canadian who's used to wide open spaces and straight roads. None of this detracts from the house, which was exactly as advertized.\r\n\r\nOverall, the house was what we expected, the hosts were fantastic, and the view of the ocean off the lanai is great. We had an excellent time, and I would recommend this house to anyone who wants to \"get away from it all\" in a secluded location."
            },
            {
                "_id": "27971914",
                "date": "2015-03-15T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "28935124",
                "reviewer_name": "Katie",
                "comments": "Cheryl's home is absolutely gorgeous. It's in a quiet neighborhood with wonderful views of the ocean. We loved spending time in the bright living room surrounded by views of the ocean and on the wrap around balcony. Daniel greeted us and made us feel welcome - he was full of insider knowledge and great tips. \r\n\r\nThe house is at the bottom of a steep and winding road - the drive down from the highway takes 10-15 minutes depending on your comfort. The road is well paved and you do not need a 4 wheel drive.\r\n\r\nEverything you could need for the beach is provided, including snorkel gear and kayaks. Although we didn't have the opportunity to use the kayaks or the snorkel gear because the waves were very rough near the house - I think this is uncommon and was due to a swell passing through. There are 3 good size bedrooms plus a queen bed in the game room. I think the house could comfortably sleep 4 couples plus a couple of children on air mattresses and pull out couches. Note that the game room, bathroom, and large bedroom downstairs are not connected to the main living space upstairs.\r\n\r\nVolcano National Park is about 1 - 1.5 hours away and Hilo can be reached in 2 hours with no traffic, if you really book it (we were late for a flight). Captain Cook is not too far, but the traffic took us nearly an hour. Make sure to bring your own food to the house. All kitchen items are provided.\r\n\r\nWe only wish we could have stayed longer. I think the house is a great place to relax and enjoy the quiet and wonderful view. There are some wonderful hikes nearby and Volcano National Park is not too far. We're hoping to bring our family back."
            },
            {
                "_id": "30490077",
                "date": "2015-04-23T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "23425018",
                "reviewer_name": "Tracey",
                "comments": "Having Daniel check us in was great. Gave all the pertenant information and giving us some local insite in where to go was an added bonus. By having Cheryl check in a few times before the scheduled arrival it made me feel like she was there and not just a hotel that you check in/out and thats it. Cheryl you made it a very personal experience and that is nice. Thank you.  I think the only description that I either missed or was not there was just the windy roads to mile marker 89 and the 3 miles down to the subdivision. I am very glad we arrived in daylight as the road could have been a  little scary in the dark first time round. Some people may not enjoy those trips daily up/down that road. Might be nice as a heads up for potential guests. Just a thought. The sunsets views as well as the sunrises were incredible. That was spot on. The neighborhood was very quiet and felt really safe there (when we were there). I think the place was fantastic. I sure hope that the new houses going up don't affect the view but really unless it is a high rise the views will still be spectacular. Location was great. Close to Volcano, South Point and  getting to Hilo. It was also great heading back into Kona. Windy roads definitely slow travel down but gets you to look at all the local land. We did not even have to spend money on snorkeling trips as we had enough gear and enough beaches to go do it ourselves. Tons of dolphins within feet of us. Turtles. Many fishes and we believe one small shark! I mean the beauty was everywhere. Just know that the beaches nearby are not your typical sandy white beaches but beautiful in their own special ways. Make a point to eat local kine foods. Markets, fruit/vege stands all over. Fresh fish. Cook at the house....We had a few of our best meals at home and local grown foods. No paid for luau needed. I got to eat poi daily. ONOLICIOUS! Mahalo nui Cheryl for a beautiful comfortable home and the most perfect lanai. Until next time. "
            },

                "reviewer_id": "33731921",
                "reviewer_name": "Michael",
                "comments": "We were greeted when we arrived and shown round the property in great detail.  It's a large spacious property with great views to both the lava flows and ocean.  This house is amazing and it's kinda surreal being surrounded by the black lava flows but also totally wonderful experience.  We all thoroughly enjoyed the comfort of the house and there were lots of extras in the property which made it homely and also came in very useful (kayak & snorkeling gear).  It is off the main road near the ocean so it feels very calm at night, good if you are just wanting to get away from it all.  It also makes perfect viewing for starts at night.  During the day you can take advantage of being a short drive to the volcano national park, the black or green sand beaches or a drive up to Kona or Hilo...of course there is a lot of things in the house so you could just relax there or wander down to the local fishing village and buy some fresh fish.  We did this and had a BBQ on the decking.  It was a nice way to spend our last night.  We were there 4 nights 5 days and will definitely be back...there is still SOOOOO much to do! Thanks Anna , Michael, Damien, Marika, Kerrie and Peter."

            {
                "_id": "63686049",
                "date": "2016-02-26T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "33464918",
                "reviewer_name": "Aparna",
                "comments": "Our group of 8 just returned from a 4 night stay at Cheryl's Beach House and had a wonderful time and would recommend this place to anyone looking for a great ocean side property on the South West part of the Island.  The property is set up as a nice beach house or a lake side cottage for that matter and has enough space to sleep large groups of up to 9.  The house has 3 bathrooms and modern amenities such as WiFi and a lot of beach friendly gear such as fins, snorkeling equipment, body boards, and kayaks.  There is a great DVD collection as well, specially for kids.  Enough has been said about Daniel, the wonderful neighbor and caretaker, in past reviews but I must add that he makes the stay all the more pleasant and comfortable.  He knows the Island very well and will give you valuable advice on activities and excursions among other things.  Cheryl is a great host and promptly responded to all of our inquiries and questions and made sure that we were set up for a great time prior to arrival.  Please note that the nearest supermarkets are near Kona which is a 45 minute drive so when Cheryl tells you to do grocery shopping prior to showing up at the Beach House on the first day, please take that advice.  This is a great location for visiting Volcano National Park but it is a bit of a drive if you want to visit places such as Mauna Key and Hilo so factor that into planning excursions as well.   "

            {
                "_id": "95449978",
                "date": "2016-08-19T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "79921224",
                "reviewer_name": "Hannah",
                "comments": "This location was great for the price. We originally had a larger party and our hands were tied for bed space. Some dropped out of the trip, but we decided to keep our reservation. We were pleasantly surprised by the amount of gear and the plethora of sizes the home had (kayaks, snorkels, and even water shoes). Sometimes places boast these things and they never fit or there isn't enough for everyone, but for our party of 5 there was plenty. \r\n\r\nCheryl and Daniel were great and made our late arrival very easy. There are plenty of guides and brochures in the home for activities, though everything will take some time to drive to.\r\n\r\nThe kitchen was very nice, though ants can be a problem if you leave anything on the counter. The geckos were cute to all but one in our party who doesn't like lizards.\r\n\r\nWord of warning, my boyfriend and I got eaten alive by some type of bug the first night (not sure when it happened - maybe while eating dinner outside on the patio... these weren't the typical mosquito bites - maybe fleas?), so be sure to apply plenty of bug repellent. We didn't get any more bites after using some, but it made the rest of the trip pretty uncomfortable (they were all over our feet so we couldn't wear proper shoes without discomfort). The others in our party were fine (only a couple of mosquito bites here and there). We didn't tell our hosts until the end of the trip, so there wasn't much they could do, but they said they do spray the home for pests every month. They can't help the location after all (it's a tropical island! We only wish we were better prepared)\r\n\r\nOverall, if you know what you are getting (remote, quiet, private location right on the beach), don't mind not having AC, and wear plenty of bug repellent this place is a great stay. "

                "reviewer_name": "Gary",
                "comments": "\"BEST PLACE TO STAY ON THE BIG ISLAND\"  Our family loved Cheryl's place. What a gracious person she is to share her home. It's not often that a place is better than you expect, but this time it was. We love the South Kona area, warm days, cool nights, ocean breeze, stars fill the night sky, watch wales from the deck, waves splashing on the lava, very few bugs and the ones that were there got zapped by the largest bug zapper we have every seen.                 "comments": "It was by far the best equipped rental house I've ever stayed in: travel guides, body boards, snorkeling masks, kitchen equipment, etc. One can tell it was done thinking on how to make it easier for the visitor. The deck was awesome: for both breakfast and afternoon drinks appreciating the beatiful sunsets. The house is close to lava fields, with their raw and foreign beauty."

            {
                "_id": "166581566",
                "date": "2017-07-04T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "48636722",
                "reviewer_name": "Jay",
                "comments": "Paradise Found\nThis is a great place to experience Hawaii for the first time. As a flat-lander the location was fantastic with scenic views of the Pacific. There is so much to do south of the house, from black sand beach, green sand beech the southern most point in US and Volcano National Park(VNP). The park is up there with the Grand Caynon for me. Cheryl is a great hostess and helped me with the many questions I had before the trip. When you get to the house Daniel is there to help you in any way. Cheryl and Daniel both recommended the night time Manta Ray dive(sorkel) with Hang Loose.  The drive with the rays is an experience I would never forget. "
            },
            {
                "_id": "168637260",
                "date": "2017-07-09T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "82584614",
                "reviewer_name": "Ben",
                "comments": "This was a wonderful house for a Hawaii getaway. The area is not exactly what you'd expect for Hawaiian scenery--it is in a community built on lava rocks--but it is relaxing nonetheless. The house has several high-quality kayaks that are free to use, and is very close to a very scenic cove where is excellent to use them. We spent a full day kayaking to a nearby beach, where we used sand toys that were also provided in the house.\n\nThe only downside for the house is the location: it is quite a ways south of Captain Cook, and the last few miles are down an exceptionally windy road. If you plan to travel in to Captain Cook or Kona every day, then the drive might get a bit tiresome. But you won't find a house that has nearly as good a deal as this anywhere near the cities, so you get what you pay for. For us, the opportunity to rent such a wonderful and large home for such a great rate more than made up for the commute."
            },

            {
                "_id": "204379827",
                "date": "2017-10-17T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "71260862",
                "reviewer_name": "Grace",
                "comments": "This home has something for everyone, from snorkels, to kayaks, boogie boards, and even a full set of dvd's and other entertainment to wind down after a long day out in the sun. If you're concerned with the lack of AC there's nothing better than opening up the sliding doors and letting the cool ocean breeze in. The view from the deck is beautiful, it's the perfect spot to enjoy your morning coffee or a nice homemade breakfast. Daniel was very helpful with planning out our days and the House Manual (the yellow folder) also has great suggestions for more places to explore.\n\nAll in all this house provides you with everything you need to enjoy your days on the Big Island. The rough winding road down may be tricky but definitely worth the drive overlooking a picturesque community atop majestic lava rocks. This home is definitely a rare find and the atmosphere is something everyone should seize the opportunity to experience. We loved our stay and only wish we had a few days more to enjoy it!!"

            {
                "_id": "271262557",
                "date": "2018-05-31T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "182262545",
                "reviewer_name": "Jim",
                "comments": "My visit to the Makai Hideaway was my first time in Hawai’I and my first time on Airbnb. We couldn’t have made a better choice. Cheryl has a beautiful house in a great location. We were 7 adults celebrating my daughter’s college graduation and our 32nd anniversary in May 2018. After we planned the trip, Kilaueua erupted and that made us even more excited to visit. Unfortunately, it also meant vog on our side of the island, eliminating the Fantastic Sunsets part of the equation. But it also meant less direct sun, so much cooler. Cheryl’s house is ideal if you want to get away from the madding crowd, but have access to all the Big Island has to offer. We were out of the house every day by 7am and back in time to make dinner and enjoy each other’s company. Our itinerary included Honomalino Beach, South Point, Discovery Harbor, Green Sand Beach, Punalu'u Black Sand Beach, Hilo, Rainbow Falls, Mauna Kea, Makalawena Beach, Kahalu’u Beach Park, Kealakekua Bay (visit Ehu & Kai Adventures for rentals – family-owned!), Captain Cook monument, and the City of Refuge - Pu'uhonua O Hōnaunau National Historical Park. All with Miloli’I as our home base. It IS 10 minutes off the hwy down a winding road with a 1500-foot drop in elevation, but that’s a good thing to me! There was nothing we needed that wasn’t already in the house, except food, but including spices. The property description is excellent; the house is exactly as described. One thing that I didn’t pick up on is that the water cistern isn’t for drinking water – Cheryl provides that in a couple of water cooler/dispensers with plenty of extra jugs of water. But water became our only problem – more below. Thought we would use the ping pong & pool tables, but no time – we were never in the house. Never turned the TVs on either. The house did get hot after being locked up all day, but it cooled off fast with so many windows and screen doors and fans. Costco IS a sensible first stop before coming to the house. We planned out our meals and got most all the ingredients there. We ended up with too much food though, and took most of the excess over to Pahoa to donate to the Leilani Estates evacuation center. Funny though; we didn’t seem to have an excess of alcohol.  But as with most marvelous properties, everything’s great as long as everything’s great. But what happens when something happens? I think that’s when you find out what kind of host you have. For us, it came on the 7th day- no water came out of the faucets. We let Cheryl & Daniel know, and they immediately went to work trying to find the problem. It turned out we were out of water, which was a little odd since we were fairly conservative on water use and the house has a big tank. But Daniel..."
            },
            {
                "_id": "274669449",
                "date": "2018-06-09T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "190348075",
                "reviewer_name": "Patrick",
                "comments": "Great house with a fantastic local black sand beach and wonderful ocean views.  Location is a bit off the beaten path, but it’s much closer to Volcano National Park than Kona and about equidistant to Hilo as Kona is.  Definitely fly into Kona if staying here, but if flying into Hilo be sure to take the southern route by Volcano National Park.  Finally, working with Cheryl is effortless, and the host Daniel is friendly and helpful.  Take Cheryl’s advice and be sure to shop on your way in for necessities.  Closest town with services is about 30 minutes away.  House had everything we could’ve asked for so only pick up food, drinks, etc.  All other amenities are provided."
            },

                "comments": "Cheryl's place is one of the best Airbnbs I have stayed! \nIf you are looking for somewhere calm, peaceful, and cozy, the place is the best choice!             {

            {
                "_id": "347761632",
                "date": "2018-11-11T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "161732524",
                "reviewer_name": "Hoku",
                "comments": "Everything went well. We stayed there for two days for an event down at Milolii. The whole house was already opened for us upon arrival and I had to sign a form that Daniel brought personally to the home. There were no sponges to wash dishes but was addressed by owner quickly and the manager Daniel brought them by. Upon arrival the house was extremely hot, like an oven with only 2 fans for the 14 people upstairs and downstairs. By the next morning the house cooled down much and was fine for the rest of our stay. Would recommend adding fans for every room in the future. The water was not drinkable due to the machines spitting out white particles even when we changed bottles so we were lucky we brought our own as this house is on catchment. The house was nicely decorated and very beautiful and mostly clean. It had EVERYTHING we needed from paper plates to fresh coffee and creamer and lots of dishes, dishwasher, towels etc which was a great touch. There was even a cute disco ball, pool table in the living room.  Daniel was kind of strange but didn’t bother us besides check in and we were thankful to Cheryl for her accommodating such a large group and think she really puts thought and time into her airBnB even though she is in the mainland. There is a cliff-ocean view and beautiful starry skies but the beach is a small drive away. All in all we would stay here again and thought the overall experience was great for the reason we stayed."
            },
            {
                "_id": "348925470",
                "date": "2018-11-15T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "169237335",
                "reviewer_name": "Bin",
                "comments": "住在这里真正的意义就是Honomalino海滩,一个会让你足够惊喜的黑沙滩,在这里可以感受到真正的夏威夷,人非常少,沙滩很细,非常适合游泳,浮潜和划船,这个沙滩的品质个人感觉在大岛是顶级的｡开车先到Milolii海滩,把车停在篮球场旁边,然后沿着小路徒步十几分钟就到了这个黑沙滩,路上还长了野生的诺丽果｡还有一个彩蛋,就是从房子去公路的路边上有一个自助的水果摊,有香蕉,木瓜和杨桃卖,价格非常便宜,又非常好吃,千万别错过了｡"
            },
            {
                "_id": "357284076",
                "date": "2018-12-09T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "222614238",
                "reviewer_name": "Jeffrey",
                "comments": "What an incredible place! The house is just plain gorgeous. It is decorated way beyond what you would expect of a rental vacation. You feel like you are staying at a best friend's house. The location is a tropical ocean dream with waves crashing against the shore and impossible numbers of stars at night. I will never forget having coffee on the lania; we just didn't want to leave."
            },

                "_id": "359427592",

                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "225170794",
                "reviewer_name": "Hanzhe",
                "comments": "We had a nice holiday in Cheryl's amazing house. We have found everything we need. The scenary is beautiful. Daniel is kind and humorous. His tips helped us save lots of time and money. I will recommend this house to everyone."
            },
            {
                "_id": "363930268",
                "date": "2018-12-29T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "52686127",
                "reviewer_name": "Kenya",
                "comments": "Cheryl's house is just as described.  We were a large family gathering for Christmas and it was a wonderful place to be able  to do just that.  It was spacious and clean and offered great amenities for the kids to play as well as what you would need to take to the beach  The morning view was my favorite, very relaxing and beautiful. The kids loved the adventures to the water and discovering hidden gems.  The community has a speed limit of 15 mph with very little traffic so the kids were able to walk and play carefree outside.  This made my 6th trip to Hawaii (first to Kona) and it was simply wonderful. The house is on the south end of the island which is good in regards to proximity to beautiful beaches that are not crowded, including the one by the house past the village (just be prepared for a bit of a hike but it is well worth it when you arrive)  My kids and I managed to make it to 5 different beaches (1 of them 2 x) Our favorite was Punalu'u Black sand beach (sea turtles).  If you want to relax or hike or have an adventure Cheryl's house puts you in the right place to do so."
            },

                "comments": "Cheryl is a very friendly hostess. Her home has many amenities that are WONDERFUL like a ping pong table, fuzzball game, binoculars, etc. If you are prepared to be almost on a moon scape (lava) with little vegetation and don't expect that you can swim, snorkel, and kayak nearby you will have a GREAT TIME. Our family did and would recommend this place very highly."

            {

                "date": "2019-03-02T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1095174",
                "reviewer_id": "11666055",
                "reviewer_name": "Justin",
                "comments": "Cheryl’s home overlooks a beautiful lava rock view of the extremely blue Pacific Ocean.  It was a few minute walk to the ocean, but not necessarily the beach you would consider safe to swim in.  The coast is a cliff made of lava rock and a rope to pull yourself up/down to.  During the times we walked in the morning and evening (in February) the waves were crashing strongly into that coast line so we refrained from getting in.  The home is has a lot of amenities and activities for young families with kids (games, snorkel equipment, movies, etc).  Unfortunately for our stay, the place didn’t appear to be cleaned properly.  With proper cleaning, the place would be charming and perfect for families looking for a quiet place with a view."

                "_id": "4482305",
                "date": "2013-05-07T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1073607",
                "reviewer_id": "5995993",
                "reviewer_name": "Micael",
                "comments": "After 10 days in such a fantastic terrace, I can say that Natasa is simply the perfect host, and even better person! Friendly, funny and flexible, she is always ready to help, to have a conversation and she makes you feel like at home as you enter the house. The house is clean and tidy, and the kitchen and living room are spacious and with all you may need. The room itself, with double bed, is a perfect and very comfortable place to relax as at home. The house is perfectly located 1 minute (or even less) form Petersham train station, from where you get to the city in a 10 minutes ride. There is also a supermarket and shops nearby, which make it easy to get provisions. Of course, the house has Wifi connection, which is fast and reliable.\r\nThis has been the first time I book a room through Airbnb and it has been such a fantastic experience that I will definitely consider Airbnb for further stays, and if in Sydney, at Natasa’s place for sure!\r\n"
            },
            {
                "_id": "4649523",
                "date": "2013-05-18T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1073607",
                "reviewer_id": "299218",
                "reviewer_name": "Sarah",
                "comments": "Natasa is an incredibly lovely person and an amazing host! She was so friendly and helpful, always up for a chat or willing to help us with directions. The house is in an unbeatable location, right near Petersham station! It is a super short walk to the station, and just a few stops into the city center. Even though the station is so close, you can't hear the trains from the room, so a good night's sleep is guaranteed. The room itself is very big and gorgeous! Natasa really has an eye for decorating and designed the room to be not only beautiful but very functional! There is tons of storage space, including two locking bedside cabinets. The kitchen is also wonderful and Natasa was kind enough to let us use a shelf in the pantry and another in the fridge. We loved staying here so much and were so sad to leave! Natasa, thank you again for all of your kindness and generosity - you're the best! "
            },

                "reviewer_name": "Tomislav",
                "comments": "This place is awesome! Me and my wife stayed here for nearly 2 weeks and we felt so comfortable and welcome.             {
                "_id": "12050316",
                "date": "2014-04-22T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1073607",
                "reviewer_id": "10434016",
                "reviewer_name": "Amanda",
                "comments": "I have so many great things to say about my 4 week stay with Natasa that I don't know where to start!  Natasa is very welcoming, and she made me feel right at home from the moment I got there.  She is generous and flexible--and one of the happiest people to be around.  Natasa always had the perfect suggestion of where to go, what to do or the best way to get there.  She knows the city really well, and is always happy to give suggestions (or show you herself!).  Natasa will talk with you as much or as little as you want, but we had a great time hanging out downstairs--I never felt like I needed to be in my room.  She even invited me to her famous pizza night with her friends--yum!\r\n\r\nAs for the house/room--it was great.  The location is amazing--so close to both the Petersham train station and a short walk to all of the Parramatta Rd buses.  Everything you need will be close by or short walk away.  The house is great--clean, homely and has everything you need! The green room was perfect--great hard wood floors, comfortable bed, plenty of space for my things--as advertised.  Even with 3 or 4 of us in the house, I never had to wait for the bathroom--everyone had such different schedules that it always seemed to work out.  I did laundry quite a few times while I was there, which was no problem at all--there is a dryer or clothes line.  \r\n\r\nI would not hesitate for a second to book this house again!  It made my time working away from home so much better by being around lovely people in a very nice home.  I loved it and I hope I get the chance to visit Natasa in Petersham again soon!"
            },

                "reviewer_id": "51816084",

                "comments": "Natasa was absolutely lovely. She described how to get to her place in great detail and even helped me put with my Uber on the last day.\nHer place was cosy and she even took me out around Sydney!\nHer place is literally next to the train station which works great if you don't drive in Sydney.\nShe had a dozen types of teas for me to select from and also gave me recommendations for things to visit.\nI felt very welcomed and at home - as though I had been living there for months!\nWould definitely stay there again and hang out with Natasa. :)"

                "reviewer_name": "Monika",
                "comments": "I selected this airbnb on the basis of its proximity to my son's place.  Although I didn't meet tge host There was very good communication sbout getting into the premises and other facilities. I had a very comfortable night's sleep. My room was very large and the shared facilities were fine. Close to Petersham eailway station which is a plus."
            },
            {
                "_id": "176443790",
                "date": "2017-07-31T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1073607",
                "reviewer_id": "12456792",
                "reviewer_name": "Nancy",
                "comments": "From the moment I arrived at Natasa's I felt at home. She insisted on carrying my massive suitcase up the stairs for me, while explaining the layout of her home. She even suggested a wonderful spot for brunch for my friend and I. (I should actually say even before I arrived since she was extremely flexible and allowed me to alter my stay to a couple days later). My entire stay was extremely comfortable. Natasa gives the perfect balance of privacy and companionship to her guests. She never once disturbed me, but was always willing to have a chat on the rare occasion that we crossed paths (we both were in and out of the house quite often). Any time I was unsure of something she was available by text and always had a quick response. The location is also extremely convenient as it is only about a block from the Petersham station where I was able to catch either the bus or train to wherever I needed to go. You can take the bus to a grocery store, but Norton Plaza has 2 grocers as well as other little shops, and is only about a 10min walk. My only regret is that I did not book Natasa's place for my entire trip! If I return to Sydney I will definitely be booking her home again, and would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a comfortable and convenient location, hosted by an extremely friendly and hospitable individual."
            },

        "reviews": [
            {
                "_id": "5356313",
                "date": "2013-06-25T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1098211",
                "reviewer_id": "6991620",
                "reviewer_name": "Matthew",
                "comments": "We stayed at this little quaintly situated sweetheart of an apartment for 3 nights in June and would return. Fits 2 people no problems, and the decorations surround you with a glow of warmth and style. If Location to some of Sydney's great lifestyle treats is an important point for your visit, then this place is well worth considering. See you again Serena!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "5756321",
                "date": "2013-07-15T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1098211",
                "reviewer_id": "6330061",
                "reviewer_name": "Katharina",
                "comments": "I stayed at Serena's flat for two weeks in July, it's a cosy little place, perfectly located to discover the city and the thriving night life around Kings Cross and Surry Hills. Getting around from here is also quite easy - the train station of Kings Cross is just across Williams St and you have buses all around you. The flat is in the basement so no views and it can be a bit dark in winter, but in summer it won't get so hot. The kitchen has all the basic facilities you would need for a holiday stay, the bathroom is neat and everything was tidy.\r\nContact and Check-in/Check-out was easy and prompt, with complementary fruit, bread rolls, jam and milk to start off my stay. There is an ATM right next to the entrance and a bakery across the street, so all very handy."
            },
            {
                "_id": "5946864",
                "date": "2013-07-23T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1098211",
                "reviewer_id": "2307909",
                "reviewer_name": "Natasha",
                "comments": "Serena's apartment is tidy, comfy, attractively decorated and perfectly located just steps from bars, pubs and restaurants. She left us gift basket of jam, fruit, oatmeal and buns that was much appreciated. We could hear music from a nearby club or bar so would advise earplugs but we slept well. Great hot shower! We would definitely recommend it to others. Thanks!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "6254557",
                "date": "2013-08-05T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1098211",
                "reviewer_id": "5010152",
                "reviewer_name": "Jackie",
                "comments": "Serena's place is superbly located, pretty much across the road from King's Cross, a short walk into the CBD with easy access to public transport. We stayed for a weekend, and were lucky enough to be able to check in on the Friday morning, as there hadn't been anyone staying in the apartment the night before. Serena greeted us, gave us advice about the area, and had even made us a breakfast hamper complete with home made jam!\r\n\r\nThe apartment had everything we needed, and was very nicely decorated. The only down side was a fair bit of nighttime noise, as it is located in quite a happening area and we were there over the weekend. Luckily we're not particularly light sleepers so we were still able to sleep.\r\n\r\nOverall it was a great weekend, and we would definitely stay there again."
            },
            {
                "_id": "6371875",
                "date": "2013-08-10T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1098211",
                "reviewer_id": "946943",
                "reviewer_name": "Annie",
                "comments": "Serena's apartment is centrally-located and near a lot of great restaurants and bars. The coffee shop next door was really nice. Serena was a great host and greeted us with a tasty breakfast basket. The apartment itself was nice and clean although somewhat dark and the main window faced a lightly frequented alleyway so we generally kept the blinds shut. That said, it was a good place for the price and I would recommend it."
            },
            {
                "_id": "6430217",
                "date": "2013-08-12T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1098211",
                "reviewer_id": "7468579",
                "reviewer_name": "Carolyn",
                "comments": "Had a really great stay at Serena's apartment.  The location was great - we arrived at Sydney airport at 9pm, by 9.30, we were meeting Serena at the apartment and by 10pm we were meeting friends at the Kings Cross Hotel down the street.  Very convenient!\r\n\r\nThe apartment was thoughtfully decorated, the breakfast was simple and nice, the bed was comfy, the bathroom clean.  No complaints!  Surprisingly quiet for the middle of the city.  Would definitely recommend!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "6698994",
                "date": "2013-08-21T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1098211",
                "reviewer_id": "8119035",
                "reviewer_name": "Azizi",
                "comments": "My wife, daughter and I had an amazing time in Sydney and staying at Serena's place. \n\nThe location is great, it is walking distance from most tourist attractions in the city (if you love a bit of walking like we do - about 25 mins walking to Opera house, Darling Harbour).  Supermarket is just around the corner. And if you are a Muslim looking for halal food, there are a couple of halal restaurants about 5 mins walk from the apartment. \n\nSerena's apartment is nice and cozy, the kitchen is well equipped for cooking a simple meal. \n\nOh and Serena is very flexible with check-ins and check-outs; which is super helpful when travelling with a toddler. \n\nAll in all, it is a great place to stay if you are travelling as a couple or with a small child. "
            },
            {
                "_id": "9759254",
                "date": "2014-01-08T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1098211",
                "reviewer_id": "10308942",
                "reviewer_name": "Brigitte",
                "comments": "I´ve been in Serena´s Place for a bit more than two weeks with my 15-year-old daughter. Everything was nice and clean and very well equipped and organized. We loved staying there. Thanks to Serena."
            },
            {
                "_id": "9835300",
                "date": "2014-01-13T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1098211",
                "reviewer_id": "2253006",
                "reviewer_name": "Jessie",
                "comments": "We had a fantastic mini break at Serena's apartment. It's a great location, very secure, nicely decorated, clean and very comfortable. Serena (and her mum, who kindly checked us in) was a very welcoming host, who was extremely responsive to any queries before and during our stay. It's right near kings cross, and we were there on the weekend, but no problems with noise, and we slept really well."
            }
        ]

                "reviewer_name": "JaeYoon",
                "comments": "Never go to this flat if you do not want to waste your money. I stayed here for 44 nights and she cleaned maybe one time before we arrived there. And was it clean? Not at all. She just pretend she cleaned (or maybe just organized a bit) but actually every corner I could find dust everywhere. And AMAZINGLY, she asked us 7EUR for each person for linen service. She said it includes sheets, pillow cover, table sheet, and serviettes. What kind of tourists is bringing their own sheets and table covers?? Don't you think of course it has to be included on the huge money I already paid? More than 1700Euros for 44nights? I think it is ridiculous and she knows that we are tourists and we don't know how it is going on exactly and tried to steal our money with any ways she can try. When we were looking for the flats, there were barely left the places and we didn't have choices and we were desperate so paid 14EUR for that. (One more thing here, this place was left until the last moment . Hope you know what it means) But there was even no serviettes and only blanket and pillow cover. And the facility. INCREDIBLY old and it looks that she doesn't live there so she doesn't care at all. The washing machine never closes the door maybe you need to try 1000 times. And I sent her a message for help and her answer was 'try gently again'. If she got money then she needs to serve proper services with that money. The facility is not only old but also not working. The host only thinks about money without helps for the money. This is the chat about paying the rest money when I did not know the cash paying is not allowed. Finally we asked Airbnb to explain her about the money.\nLast but not least, The house has Wifi.\nBut, most of time it doesn't work. And only one small tiny place works very seldomly.         "space": "Our Home  Our home is a classic Brooklyn brownstone with traditional detail but a modern renovation to give it a light and open feeling.         "description": "Our 4-bedroom, 3-story beautiful Brooklyn townhouse is a great place to stay for your NYC trip.   Located in Fort Greene, right in the heart of Brownstone Brooklyn's Arts District and only 10 minutes by Subway to Manhattan. Our Home  Our home is a classic Brooklyn brownstone with traditional detail but a modern renovation to give it a light and open feeling. An open living room, dining room and very modern kitchen makes up the 1st floor. Out the back door and down a stairway from the ground floor, you will find our beautiful back garden filled with herbs, flowers, and vegetables. The master bedroom, study/guest bedroom, walk-in closet, and master bathroom make up the second floor. The master bedroom has a king-sized bed and nice views to the backyard. The master bathroom has a beautiful pebble-floored, two-headed shower, and matching modern sinks.   The study/guest bedroom has a queen bed.   There is a heavy curtain separating the two bedrooms on this floor rather than a door so there ",
        "neighborhood_overview": "Fort Greene is one of the classic brownstone neighborhoods of Brooklyn, brimming with the energy of New York City.  Our house is one block from the world famous performance space Brooklyn Academy of Music and two blocks from the Frederick Law Olmsted-designed Fort Greene Park where you'll find a weekly farmer's market, a regular pickup soccer match, outdoor musical performances, tennis courts, playgrounds, and families picnicking. Along Fulton and DeKalb streets, you'll find restaurants with Manhattan-quality food but Brooklyn prices. Only 1 stop from Chinatown and 2 stops from Union Square on the Q train, you can easily spend your days touring busy Manhattan and retreat to our quiet, lovely house and garden for a more relaxed experience.  We love our house and our neighborhood and know that you will too.",
        "notes": "Downstairs Tenants – We have a rental apartment on the bottom floor underneath our house with a  long-term tenant who also serves as our house manager. As of July 1st, after surveying our guests, we no longer offer cable television.  We do have great Wi-Fi (see instructions for network and password) so you can still stream your favorite media.",
        "transit": "The great thing about Fort Greene is it has amazing subway access.  We are a 5-minute walk to the following lines:  Q,B,G,A,C, 2,3,5,6 which means you can get to any part of Manhattan easily.",
        "access": "There is a lockbox with keys outside the house.  If I accept your reservation, I will e-mail you the code for the lockbox before you move in.",
        "interaction": "Contacts – Next door neighbors (to the right if you are facing our front door) are Martin (pronounced Mar-teen) and Pam.",

            {

                "listing_id": "1155475",
                "reviewer_id": "8561640",
                "reviewer_name": "Magdalena",
                "comments": "Jons und Lisas sehr schönes und gemütliches Brownstonehouse liegt in Fort Greene in Brooklyn. Wir mochten die Umgebung sehr und haben die vielen kleinen Cafes und die tollen Restaurants sehr genossen. Vor allem WALTERS in der Dekalb Ave.\r\nIm Haus in der St Felix Street haben wir uns von der ersten Sekunde an wohl gefühlt und haben unsere Wahl in den neun Tagen unseres Aufenthalts kein einziges mal bereut. Jon hat uns im Vorfeld sehr viele gute Tips die Gegend betreffend gegeben und hat uns den Schlüssel sogar per FedEx nach Berlin geschickt.\r\nIm Haus selber ist genug Platz, wenn man zu viert anreist hat jeder ein eigenes Schlafzimmer, es ist aufgeräumt und sauber, das Internet funktioniert einwandfrei und in der Küche macht es großen Spaß zu kochen...\r\nall thumbs up!!! "
            },
            {

                "reviewer_id": "11300619",

                "comments": "We had a really nice stay in Jon and Lisa's house in Ft Greene (Brooklyn) during the Spring holidays, April 2014  The house is spacious (we were 7 adults) and nicely decorated.             {
                "_id": "58836623",
                "date": "2016-01-05T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1155475",
                "reviewer_id": "47645676",
                "reviewer_name": "Jesus",
                "comments": "We secured the property way before the arrival date as we thought it was a perfect match to our needs - a large group of adults and three kids - , and the property stayed to our expectations, in fact I would say exceed them probably a bit. The pictures were very accurate, so they were no surprises there. This part of Brooklyn is what New York is all about, a real mix, I would recommend it to anyone that is deciding between staying in  Manhattan or elsewhere outside the big apple. Jon has been very responsive throughout the period we secure the property. Even when his oven stopped working - which was a big deal for us - he told us in advance and managed to secure an alternative, which we finally decided not to use (hope that's ok Jon). My only comment that I think could improve anyone's stay in the future is a mini map of the house pointing to where the basics are, what to use and what not to. It is almost self intuitive, but for someone that was using the service for the first time, I had lots of questions at the very beginning. Can I use this?, do you mind if we eat that?, in any case as I said Jon was always very responsive despite being away in the busiest annual holiday of the year."
            },

                "reviewer_id": "9927494",
                "reviewer_name": "Catherine",
                "comments": "I may repeat what some others have already mentioned, but it's worth mentioning again! \nWe arrived a couple hours early and were able to check-in. This was helpful since we had our bags with us. It might not always be an option due to cleaning, but it worked out well for us. The place was clean upon arrival. The photos and directions were just as they were in the listing. It was very easy to find once we exited the subway. \nSeveral subway stops nearby was very helpful since we were visiting different areas of the city. We were here for the NYC marathon. 3 of us were running and 3 were cheering. It's right near the 8 mile mark, so that was easy for the fans. It was also easy for us to take 1 subway to the Staten Island Ferry in Manhattan to get to the start of the marathon. \nThere were 6 of us and there was plenty of room. Kitchen was fully stocked with dishes, pans etc. There was also plenty of towels and soap for the bathrooms. \nWe didn't use the backyard, but it is a nice space to have. There were all adults in our group, but it would accommodate families with children as well. \nThe area has plenty of nice restaurants and shops nearby. \nCommunication with Jon was easy and he always responded quickly.\nI would recommend his place to anyone!"

                "date": "2017-11-23T05:00:00.000Z",

                "reviewer_id": "293271",
                "reviewer_name": "Jonathan",
                "comments": "We had a great experience staying at Jon's place. The home was both pretty and spacious enough for our larger group.             {
                "_id": "217955875",
                "date": "2017-12-10T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1155475",
                "reviewer_id": "2954432",
                "reviewer_name": "Jake",
                "comments": "I stayed with Jon during a Christmas reunion with my family (one couple from Seattle, one from Texas, and my wife and I visiting from Amsterdam). First, Jon's house is in an excellent location- there is plenty to do within walking distance (grocery stores, restaurants, and even the Barclay's center), plus the connection to public transport is outstanding- there are a few stops within a 5-10min walk, leaving you with tons of local / express train options. We traveled to Manhattan every day and never spent more than 30min on the train. Additionally, the house is huge and never felt small with six of us there. The kitchen is big enouch to cook a modest meal, and the dining / living rooms are perfect places for larger groups to reconnect after a day of activities. There's also two full bathrooms, so just a tiny bit of planning prevents any bathroom scheduling conflics.\n\nThe main thing that keeps this from being a perfect rental is the sleeping arrangements- there is really only one real bed suitable for two people. There's a second queen bed in the listing that can accommodate two people, but it's only a sofa-bed in the 2nd floor study (separated from the main bedroom by a curtain). The 3rd and 4th bedrooms on the 3rd floor have twin beds which, though more comfortable than the sofa-bed, will always feel like two separate beds even when pushed together. Families or groups with people desiring individual beds will be fine here (the top two bedrooms would be perfect for a few kids or friends bunking together to save money), but you if your party has more than one couple, you might consider other options.\n\nAll things considered, this property is a pretty good value- it's a huge place that can accommodate many people, and it's in a perfect location. However, if I were to return for a similar trip, I'd only consider a return visit if at least one more queen+ bed was added."
            },

                "reviewer_id": "15667184",
                "reviewer_name": "Jeffron",
                "comments": "Impeccable home in a great location, really accessible to all areas of Manhattan and Long Island. Amazing value, highly recommend staying here for any NYC visits sort- or long-term c:"

            {
                "_id": "221740767",
                "date": "2017-12-27T05:00:00.000Z",

            {
                "_id": "222396447",
                "date": "2017-12-29T05:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1155475",
                "reviewer_id": "1877956",
                "reviewer_name": "Philippe",
                "comments": "The house is SPACIOUS and PERFECTLY LOCATED (walking distance to the B and 4-5 lines which take you all over Manhattan in a few minutes... and more lines). Fort Greene is a also a great neighborhood itself with lots of shopping options, the park and the BAM. The house itself is very nice, arranged over three floors with a large yard on a quite street. Check in was completely painless and Jon was super responsive when we had an issue with internet.\nOverall it's a great house and a unique experience to pretend to live in such a coveted neighborhood. However, I ended up paying about 800 per nigh because it was the holiday season and I am going to write a review based on this price. \nThere are a few things that COULD BE IMPROVED though. First, I somehow convinced that this would be a house in which Jon lives but this is not his primary residence. As a result, the house feels like a rental with older furniture and rather empty (plates and most cups are made of plastic for example, and I doubt anyone would live like that). \nApart from salt and a few spices, it was hard to find something to cook with so we had to buy pretty much everything to make French Toasts in the morning for the kids. It would have even nice to find sugar or syrup for example. Other than that, the kitchen is rather well equipped with pans and a nice gas range.\nFinally, my main sore point is about comfort. Were were two adult couples and two young kids. Kids slept very well and had basically all of the third floor for themselves, including a private bath with a tub. This was great!! The master bedroom was spacious and quiet and the bed was ok. However, the second bedroom was not so comfortable and rather small. Two nights were probably the most we could take in it. The bathroom is great though: excellent water pressure, hot water for everyone.\nAlso, as we were about to check in, Jon let us know that the washer was broken. This was of course not a problem but I believe that it had prevented the cleaning person to wash the linens, which smelled like someone else had slept in them. The towels also smelled moldy. It's pretty clear that all were thrown in the dryer without a wash and I would have preferred if we were told about this."
            },

                "comments": "I stayed at Jon’s beautiful house with my family of 7 people plus an 8 month old baby, for just under a week and we had the best time!                 "comments": "Nous avons passés un très bon séjour dans cette maison !!!\nLa maison: elle est spacieuse et fonctionnelle.\nDisposant de deux vastes chambres avec lits doubles au premier étage et de deux chambres supplémentaires plus petites au second étage, avec deux lits simple chacune.\nLes salles de bains sont pratiques.\nLa cuisine est bien équipée.\nLa terrasse, bien que non éclairée, est fort agréable pour profiter d'un moment au frais lors du petit déjeuner ou en fin de journée.\n\nLa localisation: la maison est située à proximité de plusieurs stations de métro proposant une multitude de lignes disponibles - que ce soit pour se déplacer dans Brooklyn, ou aller sur Manathan.\nLes commerces sont nombreux: Whole Food Market, petites commerces type épiceries à deux pas, un magasin de vins et spiritueux au coin de la rue pour découvrir quelques vins locaux, de nombreux restaurant proposant toute sorte de cuisine avec possibilité de plats à emporter....             {
                "_id": "327352837",
                "date": "2018-09-23T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1155475",
                "reviewer_id": "41471022",
                "reviewer_name": "Julia",
                "comments": "Fab and funky house in great location in Brooklyn. Felt like a really safe area, super close to lots of subway stations making it really easy to get into Manhattan and around Brooklyn.  Very close, 3 minute walk, to a fab Wholefoods 365, love that shop ! and also some really fab local restaurants, great brunch at Cafe Paulette round the corner.\nHouse is a great space for a big group, with 4 bedrooms, so worked really well for our 2 families who were in Brooklyn for a wedding. Main bedroom at back of house is lovely and master shower good too. Lots of closet space and great to have laundry room. Felt very safe in the house, very secure locks etc. Some bits of house could do with a bit of TLC, but it is a great space for a big group to all be together on a trip to NYC."
            },
            {
                "_id": "331011088",
                "date": "2018-10-01T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1155475",
                "reviewer_id": "35187255",

                "comments": "La maison est dans son ensemble agréable , bien  aménagée et la vue sur les arbres coté cours est très jolie."
            },
            {
                "_id": "332522847",
                "date": "2018-10-05T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "1155475",
                "reviewer_id": "182120233",
                "reviewer_name": "Lynn",
                "comments": "Would stay again in Jon’s family home in a heartbeat! We loved living life in Brooklyn. Great street in a great location for local shops/ restaurants/ takeout and only minutes walk to Subway stations (Atlantic Station being the main one)\nThe B line subway takes you directly into Manhattan in under 20 minutes and services are frequent. We navigated the subway with our 4 children and managed! \nThe 4 bedroom/ 3 level brownstone home is stylish, spacious and very comfortable. We never felt cramped as a family of 6 even once. The local  area felt safe and friendly. Jon provides a pack and play porta cot and even went out and purchased a stroller for us to use during our stay so we had a spare one for our 3 year old who wouldn’t cope with all the walking in NY. This was incredibly thoughtful and generous of the host so we could avoid expensive hire charges and having to wait in for a hire stroller to be delivered. \nHighly recommend Jon’s house for families looking to live like a local\nfor a few days. Brooklyn is a great place and I’d stay there again in future and use it as a base to explore both Brooklyn and all the tourist attractions in Manhattan - beats a hotel room any day. Thanks for having our family stay Jon!"
            },
            {

                "reviewer_id": "3047460",
                "reviewer_name": "Laetitia",
                "comments": "We stayed there with two children under 10 and 4 adults. It was absolutely perfect. Lots of room. Very relaxing and quiet place all over the house. Park and playground walking distance. The kitchen has all the basics for cooking. We mostly made breakfast and found everything we needed including sugar, tea and coffee. There are plates and cups for little kids to use. We would definitely come back again!"
            },

                "_id": "277697",
                "date": "2011-05-23T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "117425",
                "reviewer_id": "593270",
                "reviewer_name": "Anan",
                "comments": "Really beautiful apartment with stunning views of the city. The place was immaculate, brand new, felt barely touched. Loved being by the water. We were only a few blocks from the L train, which is one stop from the city making it pretty convenient - though we ended up cabbing it most of the time. \r\nWilly, the host, was great, very easy to communicate with and everything was super smooth. No complaints. Hope to stay there again sometime. If you are a TV junky, do be aware there isn't one in the apartment, but we spied one in the common area you may be able to take advantage of.\r\nOverall, 5 stars without a doubt!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "288732",
                "date": "2011-05-30T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "117425",
                "reviewer_id": "597975",
                "reviewer_name": "Joy",
                "comments": "We loved our stay in Brooklyn. \r\nThe location could not have been better...\r\n contrast the quietness of this East River highrise  and then, within a few minutes  walk to the subway, we were in  Manhattan!!\r\nThe view from  the 14th floor was magnificent.\r\nThe place was neat and clean, fresh and new.\r\nState of the art modern minimalism.\r\nThe door men were very nice and welcoming.\r\n\r\n"
            },
            {
                "_id": "384253",
                "date": "2011-07-19T04:00:00.000Z",

                "reviewer_id": "812074",
                "reviewer_name": "ScottandJill",
                "comments": "Great neighborhood, great building, airy and light decor, and all just a short walk away from the promenade!  Willy is a blessing....thank you for providing an accomodation so close to family!!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "415301",
                "date": "2011-08-02T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "117425",
                "reviewer_id": "765476",
                "reviewer_name": "Kamil",
                "comments": "Willy is a wonderful host. Very helpful and flexible. Place is just great - very bright, clean room with calm, diffused light coming from big windows (so many of them!). Superb neighbourhood. Thank you Willy once more!"
            },
            {
                "_id": "447403",
                "date": "2011-08-15T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "117425",
                "reviewer_id": "797193",
                "reviewer_name": "Colin",
                "comments": "I would highly recommend all those reading this review to book this apartment. My girlfriend and I had a fantastic stay in Willy's apartment and we wish we could return.\r\n\r\nWe booked this place almost last minute as I had to move to New York to start a job and look at apartments. We're glad we went with this one. It is half a block away from the R and only a few blocks from basically every other subway line worth having in Brooklyn. We could be in Manhattan in a minute's notice. \r\n\r\nIt is only a few blocks away from Montague St, the short shopping street in the middle of Brooklyn Heights, and a little farther away from Court St, the main shopping street this side of the Gowanus Canal. In short, the location is ideal. Don't pass this place up.\r\n\r\nThe apartment itself is spacious and light. The main room/bed room has two windows on three of its four walls and is constantly filled with light. The girl who lives there is a photographer, and it is obvious that she cares about the quality of the light in the room. To top it off, the apartment is appropriately accented with a few mirrors, which brightens the space even more. The bed, with its foam and vinyl mattress, is an absolute pleasure to sleep on. \r\n\r\nThose who come to New York fearing about grime and pests need not be afraid of this apartment. It is kept immaculately clean, and we stayed there ten days without seeing even a single fly. \r\n\r\nSheets and towels are provided, as well as a mostly empty closet and lots of reading material. The internet in the apartment has its ups and downs, but is mostly and unfortunately fairly slow.\r\n\r\nAgain, you would be a fool to pass this place up, especially at this price. "
            },

            {
                "_id": "644509",
                "date": "2011-10-19T04:00:00.000Z",
                "listing_id": "117425",
                "reviewer_id": "789422",
                "reviewer_name": "Jennifer",
                "comments": "First of all, we loved the neighborhood.  It was very close to several subway lines and shops, not to mention the river, from which there is such a beautiful view.  \r\n\r\nSecond, the apartment is a lovely alternative to getting a hotel.  While there were a couple of quirks, they weren't substantial in any way and the price was more than 50% less than nearby hotels.  The lighting in the place is stunning and the building tends to be very quiet.  Getting the keys was not a problem.  We had a bit of trouble getting in to the building a couple of times, but that was resolved with the help of a friendly neighbor who was our designated contact since the host is away.  The door to the apartment was a difficult to unlock as well, but that may have been my error.\r\n\r\nOverall, I would very highly recommend staying at Willy's place.
